title: Public safety organizations (UCLA Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Public safety organizations (UCLA Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records from Oct 1st, 2023 through June 26, 2024 concerning the following volunteer / non-profit security groups and individuals:

* MagenAm (also spelled Magen Am)
* Shmira
* Hatzolah
* Magivim
* Yossi Eilfort (also do a keyword search for just the last name, Eilfort)

Please include all communications between your office/agency and these groups and/or individuals, plus any records with the following domain names and/or keywords, for the same date range specified above.

* lashmira.org
* magenam.com
* hatzolahofla.org
* magivim.org
* Yossi Eilfort (also do a keyword search for just the last name, Eilfort)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chad Loder

communications.subject: Records Request -- MuckRock News (24-3840)
communications.communication:
Dear Chad Loder,

In your attached request, we found them to be vague and overbroad as to the documents you are requesting. In an effort to provide you with the specific records that will be most helpful to you, by way of this e-mail, we ask for your assistance in clarifying and narrowing your request.

UCLA does not operate on a centralized system, and as such, we must reach out to a custodian directly. We are not able to search in a centralized system for all University records (or the records of an entire department such as UCLA police department) to figure out who may be the holder of a certain document or email.

Because your request currently lists no names of UCLA staff whose records you specifically seek, we request that you specify UCLA staff names and/or titles. Otherwise, we are not able to conduct a search for records.

We will keep your request open for 10 business days from the date of this email.
Best Regards,

UCLA Information Practices
records@ucla.edu
(310) 794-8741

communications.communication:
On June 27th, 2024 the UCLA Information Practices team responded to this request by saying:

"UCLA does not operate on a centralized system, and as such, we must reach out to a custodian directly. We are not able to search in a centralized system for all University records (or the records of an entire department such as UCLA police department) to figure out who may be the holder of a certain document or email.

Because your request currently lists no names of UCLA staff whose records you specifically seek, we request that you specify UCLA staff names and/or titles. Otherwise, we are not able to conduct a search for records."

Under Gov. Code §7922.600 ("Duty to Assist in Formulating Request"), UCLA is required to assist in identifying responsive records and to provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the records or information sought. communications.communication:
CC compliance@ucla.edu, Oversight Committee

It has now been over nine months since we made our initial CPRA request to your office. We have yet to receive a single responsive record. If we do not begin receiving rolling production requests of the already-reviewed records by Monday, April 14th, 2025 with regular rolling production on a monthly basis until the entire request is satisfied, we will be forced to pursue legal action.

title: Civil Commitment Data and Demographic Breakdown for Illinois (Department of Human Services)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Civil Commitment Data and Demographic Breakdown for Illinois (Department of Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Total number of individuals civilly committed in Illinois for the most recent calendar year (2024), or the latest year for which data is available. 
Demographic breakdown of the civilly committed by:
Disability status (e.g., mental illness, intellectual disability, etc.)
Race
Gender
Housing status at the time of commitment (e.g., stably housed, homeless, in transitional housing)
Citizenship status (e.g., U.S. citizen, non citizen)
Region of commitment (please breakdown by city, county, and/or state region, if available)
If at all possible, please provide both numerical counts and percentages for each subcategory. 
Please provide this information in electronic format (PDF, Excel or CSV preferred). If records are only partially available or some data fields cannot be broken down as requested, I ask that any available portions still be provided. If any part of this request is unclear, I welcome clarification to ensure that it is processed efficiently.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Center for Racial and Disability Justice

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Civil Commitment Data and Demographic Breakdown for Illinois (Department of Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Illinois Freedom of Information Act. request, copied below, and originally submitted on June 20, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Inquiry about your Freedom of Information Act Request (25-FTS-7809)
communications.communication:
Dear Muckrock.com:

Confirming receipt of Freedom of Information Act request on June 20, 2025, although in your email below, the request is dated June 17, 2025.  Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body is allowed five business days from the date of receipt in order to respond to a Freedom of Information Act request.  Our response to you is due on Friday, June 27, 2025.  The Department is still working on your request and a more formal response will be sent to you by close of business on June 27.

K.

communications.subject: 25-FTS-7809 MuckRock- EXTENSION REQUEST
communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock:

The Illinois Department of Human Services received your Freedom of Information Act request on June 20, 2025.  You requested the following information:


Total number of individuals civilly committed in Illinois for the most recent calendar year (2024), or the latest year for which data is available.
Demographic breakdown of the civilly committed by:
Disability status (e.g., mental illness, intellectual disability, etc.)
Race
Gender
Housing status at the time of commitment (e.g., stably housed, homeless, in transitional housing)
Citizenship status (e.g., U.S. citizen, non citizen)
Region of commitment (please breakdown by city, county, and/or state region, if available)
If at all possible, please provide both numerical counts and percentages for each subcategory.
Please provide this information in electronic format (PDF, Excel or CSV preferred). If records are only partially available or some data fields cannot be broken down as requested, I ask that any available portions still be provided. If any part of this request is unclear, I welcome clarification to ensure that it is processed efficiently.

The Department is still processing your request.  Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to five business days. 5 ILCS 140/3(e).    As such, the Department is extending the time to respond to your request by five business days on one or more of the following bases:



•          The requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records;

•          The request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records;

•          The requested records have not been located in the course of a routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them;

•          The requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure or

should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; and

•          The request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by FOIA without unduly burdening or interfering with the operation of the

public body.



The Department will respond to your request on or before July 7, 2025 (Friday, July 4th is a state holiday).  Thank you for your continued patience with the Illinois Department of Human Services.


Sincerely

K

Kathleen R Ward
On Behalf of IDHS FOIA Officer
Illinois Department of Human Services
69 West Washington Street
Chicago, IL  60602
312-814-4690
Kathleen.Ward@illinois.gov<mailto:Kathleen.Ward@illinois.gov>

Unauthorized use, disclosure or copying of this communication or any part thereof is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately by return e-mail and destroy this communication and all copies thereof, including all attachments. Receipt by an unintended recipient does not waive attorney-client privilege, attorney work product privilege, or any other exemption from disclosure.

Total number of individuals civilly committed in Illinois for the most recent calendar year (2024), or the latest year for which data is available.

Attached is information responsive to your request.

Please note that the Department withheld citizenship status pursuant to Section 7(1)(b) of FOIA, which applies to private information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b); 5 ILCS 140/2(c-5).

To the extent you consider any portion of this response to be an improper denial of your FOIA request, you have a right to seek review by writing to the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the following address:

Public Access Counselor
Office of the Attorney General
500 South 2nd Street
Springfield, Illinois 62706
Fax: 217-782-1396
E-Mail: Public.Access@ilag.gov<mailto:Public.Access@ilag.gov>

If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this response when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. You also have the right to seek judicial review of this response. 5 ILCS 140/11.

Thank you for your interest in the Illinois Department of Human Services.

Sincerely,


Kathleen R Ward
On Behalf of DHS FOIA Officer

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Medina Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Your City of Medina, WA public records request #25-88 has been closed.
communications.communication:
City of Medina, WA ************************************************************************ Record request #25-88 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear Rose Terse, On May 16, 2025, the City of Medina Police Department received your public records request for the following records: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system: 1. Organization Audit in Flock. The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency. 2. Network Audit in Flock. The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System. 3. A list of network share settings that include: 3a. Flock networks shared with me 3b. Networks that I’m sharing Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal. The City was able to provide records for the following: * Organization Audit in Flock - released on 6-12-2025 3a. Flock networks share with me - released on 5-22-2025 3b. Networks that I'm sharing - released on 5-22-2025 Regarding request #2. Network Audit in Flock, the City has no public records meeting the description. Our agency did not own, prepare, use, retain, or possess, or access the records that you are requesting and therefore, these are not public records under the State Public Records Act. To be a "public record" under Public Records Act, information must be (1) a writing (2) related to the conduct of government or the performance of government functions that is (3) prepared, owned, used, or retained by a state or local agency. Here, these records do not meet that criteria. See Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wn.2d 863, 880-882 (2015). The City has determined that your request has been fulfilled. This is now considered closed. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.550(6), you have one year from the date of this letter to seek judicial review of this request. If you have any questions regarding your request, please respond within twenty (20) days of this letter. Sincerely, Barbara Marxer Medina PD Records ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Medina, WA.

Technical support: See our help page

title: Diversity and Leadership Training

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Diversity and Leadership Training
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Copies of the AY 2024 - 2025 DEI/DOI/Inclusive Excellence Facilitators Guide for Cadet and Faculty Training.
2. Copies of the Instructor notes and slides (with links to any videos used) for each of the AY 2024-2025 DEI/DOI/Inclusive Excellence Facilitators' Guide for Cadet and Faculty Training.
3. Copies of the Instructor notes and slides (with links to any videos used) for each of the AY 2024-2025 DEI/DOI/Inclusive Excellence Facilitators' Guide for Board of Visitors Training.

I understand from VMI publications that annual training is required for each of these groups and that the training for cadets is specific to each class, as well as some training for the whole corps.

If any of these were already made public under other FOIA requests, I am willing to download them myself if you can provide the links.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #25-96
communications.communication:
Thank you for sending what appears to be a PARTIAL response to my FOIA.  Per my original FOIA request, the records appear to be MISSING the following records:

1. REQUESTED: Copies of the AY 2024 - 2025 DEI/DOI/Inclusive Excellence Facilitators Guide for Cadet and Faculty Training.

MISSING - Neither the Cadet nor the Faculty Facilitator's Guides were provided. If FOIA's on your site show that versions of these existed for previous years and were disclosed. I am asking for the current version for AY 2024 - 2025 - PLEASE PROVIDE THEM.

2. Copies of the Instructor notes and slides (with links to any videos used) for each of the AY 2024-2025 DEI/DOI/Inclusive Excellence Facilitators' Guide for Cadet and Faculty Training.

MISSING - No instructor notes and slides provided for FIRST CLASS (Seniors) training. VMI documentation indicates that this "training" may take the form of a guest speaker or lecture, but it should exist as VMI stated it does for all classes.

MISSING - All instructor notes and slides for VMI Faculty and Staff training that VMI states it conducts.

3. Copies of the Instructor notes and slides (with links to any videos used) for each of the AY 2024-2025 DEI/DOI/Inclusive Excellence Facilitators' Guide for Board of Visitors Training.

MISSING - None of these records were provided, although VMI Quarterly and other reports and publications state that this training is required and conducted annually for the BOV.

Thank you in advance for providing this missing information. Whereas VMI Committed and reported to the Commonwealth, and publicly posted, it is conducting this training, these records must be available unless VMI is non-compliant.

title: Request to State Department for all communications with film director Doug Liman

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to State Department for all communications with film director Doug Liman
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communications between the State Department or employees thereof and the Hollywood film director Doug Liman, born Douglas Eric Liman on July 24, 1965. Such communications may include, but should not be limited to, emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Ref: F-2024-09598
communications.communication:
Dear Brett Carollo: 

Thank you for filing your information access request to the U.S. Department of State.  Your request number is F-2024-09598. 
You will receive a formal acknowledgement to your request in no later than 10 working days.  If the Department requires additional information from you, then you will also be notified. 
Should you have any questions about your request, you may also contact us at: 
FOIAStatus@state.gov
Regards, 
Requesters Communications Branch 
Office of Information Programs and Services 
U.S. Department of State

communications.communication:
*THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL.** Dear Mr.Carollo: This email acknowledges receipt of your April 10, 2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) request received by the U.S. Department of State, Office ofInformation Programs and Services on April 10, 2024.  To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:Any communications between the State Department or employees thereof and the Hollywood film director Doug Liman, born Douglas Eric Liman on July 24, 1965. Such communications may include, but should not be limited to, emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls.I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Brett CarolloAttachments:https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/Brett-DCF/135115/501c3_application_and_approval.pdfhttps://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/Brett-DCF/135115/FOIA_waiver_letter_4-8-2024.pdfUpload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-state-14%252Frequest-to-state-department-for-all-communications-with-film-director-doug-liman-161802%252F%253Femail%253Dfoiastatus%252540state.gov&url_auth_token=AAAVJtR0f6P53ynx7ouU69HIzTQ%3A1ruQgO%3AWof7UwTJn_0M3hm2ZQPJU8-WF3gYR91EQaBuEMB2qMw (Date Range for Record Search: From 01/01/2013 To 04/10/2024). 

You are seeking a copy of  Unless you advise otherwise, we will treat as non-responsive anycompilations of publicly available news reports and any publicly availabledocuments not created by the U.S. government, such as mass-distribution emailsfrom news media.  This Office assigned your request the subjectreference number and placed it in the complex processing track where it will beprocessed as quickly as possible.  See 22 CFR § 171.11(h). 
This Office will not be able to respond within the 20 daysprovided by the statute due to “unusual circumstances.”  See 5 U.S.C.§ 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii).  In this instance, the unusual circumstancesinclude the need to search for and collect requested records from otherDepartment offices or Foreign Service posts. 
You will not be charged FOIA processingfees. 
If you have any questionsregarding your request, would like to narrow the scope or arrange analternative time frame to speed its processing, or would like an estimated dateof completion, please contact our FOIA Requester Service Center or our FOIA PublicLiaison by email at ortelephone at 202-261-8484.  Additionally, you may contact the Office ofGovernment Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and RecordsAdministration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of GovernmentInformation Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, email at (mailto:FOIAstatus@state.gov) FOIAstatus@state.gov ; telephone at202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. title: GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Essex County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Essex County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that detail the extent of your office's usage of GPS technology to monitor people in the Sheriff office's custody. This includes individuals under pretrial, sentenced, on SORB, or any other custodial status. If such a program exists, I request records that show the number of individuals currently on GPS monitors, and their status (ie pretrial, sentenced, etc).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Essex County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Massachusetts Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on June 12, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Essex County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

I am writing in response to your public records request, dated June 12, 2025, directed to the Essex County Sheriff's Department. I serve as Assistant General Counsel to the Department.  As you know, your request specifically sought "[r]ecords that detail the extent of your office's usage of GPS technology to monitor people in the Sheriff's office's custody. This includes individuals under pretrial, sentences, on SORB, or any other custodial status. If such a program exists, I request records that show the number of individuals currently on GPS monitors, and their status."

As you may know, the Essex County Sheriff's Department has multiple facilities - the Middleton House of Correction in Middleton, MA, the Essex County Pre-Release and Re-Entry Center ("ECPRC") in Lawrence, MA, and the Women in Transition ("WIT") facility in Salisbury, MA. I am advised by Department officials that every inmate at the ECPRC, both sentenced and pretrial inmates, has a GPS monitoring device. The Department reserves the right to place a GPS monitoring device on a sentenced inmate at the WIT if the Department deems it necessary.

While you requested data on the number of inmates with GPS monitoring, the overall number fluctuates daily due to new intakes, releases, etc. As of June 23, 2025, the total number was 100 - the breakdown was 92 sentenced and 8 pretrial. There are also 3 sentenced inmates who have GPS monitoring but are not in the Department's direct custody.

Thank you,

Jordan Elizabeth Mitchell
Assistant General Counsel
Essex County Sheriff's Department
20 Manning Avenue
Middleton, MA 01949

title: FBI support for National Geographic TV series "Trafficked with Mariana Van Zeller"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for National Geographic TV series "Trafficked with Mariana Van Zeller"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of National Geographic Channel TV series "Trafficked with Mariana Van Zeller," between 2019 and 2023. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Trafficked with Mariana Van Zeller," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI, confirming that, some time between 2019 and 2023, the FBI supported the production of this series. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1628230-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000
Case Type:
FOIPA
Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.


Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into small (51-250 pages), medium (251-500 pages), large (501-4,999), and extra-large (over 5,000 pages) sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  The more potentially responsive pages a request has, the more complex it becomes, greatly increasing the time required for processing. Generally, the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.
Currently, simple track cases average approximately 230 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Complex requests in the small processing track are currently averaging 1,085 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,310 days, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 2,370 days  .


Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1628230-000
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern

I am writing to appeal the decision to deny waiver of fees for request #1628230-000.

According to your determination, my request did not meet the standard for waiver of fees because it would be unlikely to contribute significantly to the public's understanding of government operations.

As I explain in my original FOIA request, I am the Director of Research Operations at a non-profit organization that makes these records available to the public. These and other records thus made available will, we hope and expect, be referenced in research papers and other writings, and the mere availability of them makes the public aware of an entire field of government operations (namely, collaboration with Hollywood) of which the public is largely not aware. This increased awareness, in turn, has the potential to transform the way the public sees films. Furthermore, I am the editor-in-chief of a research magazine published by said foundation  called "Cultural Engineering Studies," to which I also contribute articles (including a recent article on NASA's relationship to Hollywood). The magazine explores, among other topics, Hollywood's relationship to the federal government, and such documents indeed are cited in the magazine.

I therefore repeat my request for a waiver of fees, having rebutted the finding that this work does not contribute in any significant way to the public's understanding of government. 

In the event that this waiver request is not accepted, I still wish you to process the FOIA request, under the stipulations stated in the original request.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (Boulder County Clerk & Recorder Offices)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (Boulder County Clerk & Recorder Offices)
communications.communication:
Hi Aleksandra -

Our redacted 2024 General election CVR is already posted to our website here: https://bouldercounty.gov/elections/results/

Information on submitting a request for the 2022 CVR can be found here: https://bouldercounty.gov/records/colorado-open-records-act/

We do not release unredacted CVRs due to the statutory requirements around protecting voter anonymity.

Stephanie

Elections Director

Elections Division | Boulder County Clerk and Recorder’s Office

Office: 303-413-7752 | sgnoza@bouldercounty.gov<mailto:sgnoza@bouldercounty.gov>

title: Evergreen Solutions (Howard Community College)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions (Howard Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: Re: Request for Public Records  - Howard Community College
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon MuckRock News and Alisia Rios:

Please note that in the state of Maryland, "Under GP § 4-206, an official custodian may charge reasonable fees for the search and preparation of records for inspection and copying.[...] Search fees are the costs to an agency for locating requested records. Usually, this involves the cost of an employee’s time spent in locating the requested records. Preparation fees are the costs to an agency to prepare a record for inspection or copying, including the time needed to assess whether any provision of law permits or requires material to be withheld."  See Maryland Public Information Act Manual.

Furthermore, the Supreme Court of Maryland has indicated that an agency may appropriately require prepayment of fees. See Glass v. Anne Arundel County, 453 Md. 201, 212-13 (2017). And, requesting prepayment of fees before providing responsive records does not amount to a denial of the request. Glass , 453 Md. at 236-37.

Your request dated March 6, 2025, which was received on March 18, 2025, is broadly worded and would require diversion of resources to conduct an exhaustive search. Therefore, the college is requesting that you (1) focus your request on specific records that are not already accessible via the college’s website or otherwise publicly available, (2) confirm your willingness to pay the estimated associated fees for fulfilling this search prior to commencement of such search, and (3) if more time is required than estimated, pay any additional fees prior to the release of responsive records (if any). To be clear, the college has not denied your request.

Please see https://howardcc.libguides.com/bot, which contains many records regarding the governance and operations of the college.



Kind regards,


Delisle Warden

Vice President for Policy and General Counsel

Office: 443.518.4470
howardcc.edu<http://www.howardcc.edu/>

[cid:120ce402-016f-416d-984e-93c3efd29d61]

title: Evergreen Solutions (Mohawk Valley Community College)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Mohawk Valley Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Mohawk Valley Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom it May Concern:

On March 6, 2025 this office received your records request of March 6, 2025. In accordance with Article 6 of the New York Public Officers Law, please accept this letter as acknowledgement of our receipt of that request.

A determination will be made, and access to the requested records will be made as applicable, in accordance with Article 6 of the New York Public Officers Law and any other controlling statutes within 20 business days.  There may be a fee of $.25 per page for duplication of the records requested, or in certain circumstances, a document preparation fee if the records are delivered electronically.

If we are unable to determine the accessibility of the records, or are unable to compile and prepare the records within 20 days, you will be notified of the same and the date by which the request will be granted in whole or in part.


Thomas G. Squires, Vice President for Administrative Services
Mohawk Valley Community College
1101 Sherman Drive
Utica, NY 13501-5394
Telephone: 315.792.5444  Mobile:  315.657.3675

Hi Alisia,

Can you clarify what you mean by staff employees? I recognize that you are not looking for faculty. Are you looking for non-executive personnel only? And should that exclude classified employees? We can provide job descriptions which would also include grade once you clarify.

The "President's Report" included all titles for all full-time employees. The collective bargaining agreements we provided do have all salary grades for each of the unions.  The Professional Association covers all non-executive full-time staff & faculty (excluding classified which are covered in the UPSEU CBAs.) Our management confidential positions do not have salary grades.

Thanks,
Crystal

title: FBI support for 2024 Vice series "Cowboy Kings of Crypto"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2024 Vice series "Cowboy Kings of Crypto"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2024 Vice series "Cowboy Kings of Crypto." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Cowboy Kings of Crypto," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Cowboy Kings of Crypto."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Swatting Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Swatting Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Documents, memos, presentations, and emails (including attachments) written between January 1, 2020 and the date this request is processed regarding a spree of false reports of active shooting incidents called into schools and universities. A keyword search could include the words "hoax", "hoax call", "swatting", "false report" AND the words "school" or "university"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2023-IAFO-00282
communications.communication:
You have reached SecureRelease™ Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).



SecureRelease Support is not involved with the processing or prioritization of FOIA requests, and our staff cannot answer questions related to request status, expected timelines, or agency procedures. To ask for an update or discuss the specifics of your request(s), you must contact the agency directly.


If you submitted your request(s) through the SecureRelease™ Request Portal<https://www.securerelease.us/> or to a participating agency using FOIA.gov, you may use SecureRelease Portal Messages to send electronic correspondence and attachments directly to the agency.



To send a portal message:



  1.  Sign in to the SecureRelease™ Request Portal: https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/
  2.  Click the My Requests icon
  3.  Locate the request you wish to inquire about, and click on the Request Number
  4.  From the request screen, click the Messages icon at the top of the page
  5.  Click the Add Message button at the upper right
  6.  Complete the required Message Fields
  7.  Drag and drop any Files you wish to attach into the file upload box (Optional)
     *   Maximum of 25 files can be attached to a message, and total file size cannot be more than 100 mb. Supported file formats: DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, TXT, PDF, JPG, PNG, BMP and TIF/TIFF
  8.  Click Send
  9.  Return to the Messages tab within your Request to access outgoing and incoming messages


Should you have an inquiry related to your SecureRelease user account or concerning www.securerelease.us<http://www.securerelease.us>, please email us with the relevant details and a member of our support team will be happy to assist.



Take care,


SecureRelease™ Support Team
securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com<mailto:securereleasesupportteam@deloitte.com>
www.securerelease.us<https://www.securerelease.us/>

communications.communication:

All electronic communications possessed by Cristine Alilovich that contains the word "homeless" "unhoused" "mahon creek path" between January 1st, 2025 and April 23rd, 2025.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of San Rafael, CA public records request #25-151
communications.communication:
City of San Rafael, CA ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-151: Re: April 24, 2025 Public Records Act Request The City of San Rafael (“City”) is in receipt of the Public Records Act request you submitted on April 24, 2025 (“Request”).  The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act (“PRA”) (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.). Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requestor makes a specific and focused request for information, that information is maintained by the City in its ordinary course of business, the information is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort. The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request.  The City is typically afforded ten (10 days) from the date of receipt of your request to make a determination whether your request seeks disclosable public records. In accordance with the California Public Records Act, pursuant to Government Code section 7922.535(c)(1)-(4), the City will require an extension of that deadline of up to an additional fourteen (14) days to make such a determination because of the reasons checked as follows: [ X ]     The need to search for and collect the requested records from facilities separate from the office processing the request. [ X ]      The need to search for, collect, and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records that are demanded in a single request. [ X ]     The need for consultation with another department or agency that has substantial interest in the response to the request. [ ]      The need to compile data, to write programming language or a computer program, or to construct a computer report to extract data. Accordingly, the City will determine whether it possesses records responsive to your Request on or before May 19, 2025. Thank you ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of San Rafael, CA.

Technical support: See our help page

communications.communication:
City of San Rafael, CA ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #25-151 along with the following message: Re: Public Records Act Request, received on April 24, 2025 Good Afternoon, At this time, the City determines that it possesses records responsive to your Request. Please see the records released today. The City redacted certain private information, the disclosure of which would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy and/or violation of third-party rights pursuant to Article 1, Section 1 of the California Constitution. (Gov. Code § 7922.000.) The City has determined that a portion of these records are exempt from disclosure under Government Code sections 7927.705 and 7922.000 (the catchall exception), as they are protected by the attorney-client privilege and/or deliberative process privilege.  Also, the City identified 8 emails that relate to the Requestor of this Public Records Request seeking an ADA accommodation on behalf of an individual, but withheld them to protect the privacy of the individual because if they are released to the Requestor through a Public Records Act request, they will become a public record for all.  All responsive records have now been provided, and the City considers this request complete and closed. If you have any questions regarding the City’s response, please let us know here (through NextRequest). title: Washington Public Records Act Request: Personnel and Conduct Records (Jefferson County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington Public Records Act Request: Personnel and Conduct Records (Jefferson County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, I respectfully request copies of the following records covering the past ten (10) years:

Employee Information:
•	Personnel Rosters: Full list of current and former officers and staff, including names, badge numbers, 
ranks/positions, assignments, hiring dates, lengths of service, and current salaries.
•	Separated Personnel Records: Officer names, badge numbers, ranks/positions, dates of separation, reasons for separation, and any disciplinary or investigation findings related to separated employees.
•	Internal Affairs Complaints Logs: Logs of complaints filed against officers, including dates, nature of complaints, investigation summaries, and outcomes.
•	Demographic Breakdown of Staff: Information regarding race, gender, age, and years of service for all personnel.
•	Disciplinary Records: Records of sustained misconduct, reprimands, suspensions, demotions, and terminations.
•	Citizen Complaint Records: Complaints filed by members of the public, including investigation records and findings.
•	Officer Training Records: Records of completed certifications, dates of training courses, and ongoing education.
•	Use of Force Reports: Reports and records detailing any incidents where physical force was used, including the type of force (firearms, tasers, batons, etc.).
•	Officer-Involved Shooting Reports: Investigative files and administrative reviews regarding officer-involved shootings.
•	Early Intervention System (EIS) Data: Records identifying officers flagged for multiple complaints, use of force incidents, or other concerning behavior.
•	Performance Evaluations: Annual or biannual performance reviews for individual officers.
•	Grievance Records: Labor grievances filed by or against officers.
•	Supervisor Notes and Counseling Records: Informal disciplinary notes and performance counseling documentation.
•	Resignation and Retirement Records: Records detailing reasons for resignations or retirements, especially after critical incidents.
•	Awards and Commendations: Records of any awards, commendations, or honors given to officers.
•	Off-Duty Misconduct Records: Records involving arrests or disciplinary actions related to off-duty behavior.
•	Records of Lawsuits Against Officers: Civil suits alleging officer misconduct, civil rights violations, or other professional conduct matters.
•	Settlement Agreements Involving Officers: Terms and details of any settlement agreements, including any non-disclosure clauses.
•	Brady Lists: Lists or notifications identifying officers with documented credibility issues.
•	Body-Worn Camera Misuse or Policy Violation Records: Instances where officers failed to comply with body-worn camera policies.
•	Records of Transfers and Reassignments: Records regarding officer transfers or reassignments, including reasons where available.
•	Fitness-for-Duty Evaluations: Psychological or medical evaluations required after misconduct allegations or other triggering events.
•	Promotions and Demotions Records: Application materials, evaluation records, and decision memorandums regarding promotions and demotions.
•	Employment Application Materials: Initial applications, resumes, background check summaries (redacted for private information if necessary).
•	Secondary Employment Approvals: Records showing agency approval for secondary employment by officers (e.g., security jobs).
•	Internal Memos Regarding Conduct Policy Changes: Memos or correspondence discussing changes to conduct policies, disciplinary procedures, or related codes.
•	Salary Records: Current and historical salary data for all personnel, including base pay, overtime, special assignment pay, and bonuses.

Format and Fees:
In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (CSV file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

Please produce the records in electronic format (.csv, .xlsx, .ods, etc.) via email or secure download link to avoid unnecessary copying costs.

If the total estimated cost to fulfill this request exceeds $25, please provide a written, itemized cost estimate before proceeding. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.120(2)(b), I request a waiver or reduction of fees as this request is made for the purpose of public interest and community oversight, not for commercial purposes.

If Portions Are Exempt:
If any portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide a written explanation for each redaction or withheld record, citing the specific exemption relied upon.

If Delayed or Denied:
If fulfillment of this request will take longer than the statutory time frame, or if you believe any aspect is overly burdensome, please provide a written explanation identifying specifically which portions are burdensome and propose a timeline for rolling production of records as they become available.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this request. Please feel free to contact me at [Insert Your Email] if clarification is needed.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

• Secondary Employment Approvals: Records showing agency approval for secondary employment by officers (e.g., security jobs).
• Internal Memos Regarding Conduct Policy Changes: Memos or correspondence discussing changes to conduct policies, disciplinary procedures, or related codes.
• Salary Records: Current and historical salary data for all personnel, including base pay, overtime, special assignment pay, and bonuses.

If Delayed or Denied:

Aurora Quinn
