communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #S003598-042925
communications.communication:
Subject: Request for Clarification Regarding Records Request Timeline

Dear Lynn Chesterfield,

Thank you for your response to my public records request.

I respectfully express concern regarding the 60-business-day estimate provided. A comparable request submitted recently to another regional law enforcement agency was processed with a significantly shorter timeline and a projected fulfillment date of May 27, 2025. This suggests that the records I’ve requested— which are routinely maintained by public agencies— may be reasonably accessible without requiring such an extended delay.

I understand that some of the materials may require review or redaction. However, under RCW 42.56.520, agencies are required to provide the “reasonable estimate” of time necessary to produce records, and I respectfully ask for more detail as to what is contributing to this 60-business-day estimate.

If possible, I also request that responsive records be released on a rolling basis as they become available, rather than in a single, delayed release. I am open to narrowing or prioritizing specific sections of my request to assist in timely fulfillment.

Thank you again for your time and attention. I look forward to your response and hope to work collaboratively to ensure the timely release of these important public records.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S003598-042925
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 29, 2025, Reference # S003598-042925 Dear Aurora  Quinn, The County received the following public records request from you on April 29, 2025: To Whom It May Concern: 
Pursuant to the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, I respectfully request copies of the following records covering the past ten (10) years: 
Employee Information: 
1. Personnel Rosters: Full list of current and former officers and staff, including names, badge numbers, 
ranks/positions, assignments, hiring dates, lengths of service, and current salaries. 
2. Separated Personnel Records: Officer names, badge numbers, ranks/positions, dates of separation, reasons for separation, and any disciplinary or investigation findings related to separated employees. 
3. Internal Affairs Complaints Logs: Logs of complaints filed against officers, including dates, nature of complaints, investigation summaries, and outcomes. 
4. Demographic Breakdown of Staff: Information regarding race, gender, age, and years of service for all personnel. 
5. Disciplinary Records: Records of sustained misconduct, reprimands, suspensions, demotions, and terminations. 
6. Citizen Complaint Records: Complaints filed by members of the public, including investigation records and findings. 
7. Officer Training Records: Records of completed certifications, dates of training courses, and ongoing education. 
8. Use of Force Reports: Reports and records detailing any incidents where physical force was used, including the type of force (firearms, tasers, batons, etc.). 
9. Officer-Involved Shooting Reports: Investigative files and administrative reviews regarding officer-involved shootings. 
10. Early Intervention System (EIS) Data: Records identifying officers flagged for multiple complaints, use of force incidents, or other concerning behavior. 
11. Performance Evaluations: Annual or biannual performance reviews for individual officers. 
12. Grievance Records: Labor grievances filed by or against officers. 
13. Supervisor Notes and Counseling Records: Informal disciplinary notes and performance counseling documentation. 
14. Resignation and Retirement Records: Records detailing reasons for resignations or retirements, especially after critical incidents. 
15. Awards and Commendations: Records of any awards, commendations, or honors given to officers. 
16. Off-Duty Misconduct Records: Records involving arrests or disciplinary actions related to off-duty behavior. 
17. Records of Lawsuits Against Officers: Civil suits alleging officer misconduct, civil rights violations, or other professional conduct matters. 
18. Settlement Agreements Involving Officers: Terms and details of any settlement agreements, including any non-disclosure clauses. 
19. Brady Lists: Lists or notifications identifying officers with documented credibility issues. 
20. Body-Worn Camera Misuse or Policy Violation Records: Instances where officers failed to comply with body-worn camera policies. 
21. Records of Transfers and Reassignments: Records regarding officer transfers or reassignments, including reasons where available. 
22. Fitness-for-Duty Evaluations: Psychological or medical evaluations required after misconduct allegations or other triggering events. 
23. Promotions and Demotions Records: Application materials, evaluation records, and decision memorandums regarding promotions and demotions. 
24. Employment Application Materials: Initial applications, resumes, background check summaries (redacted for private information if necessary). 
25. Secondary Employment Approvals: Records showing agency approval for secondary employment by officers (e.g., security jobs). 
26. Internal Memos Regarding Conduct Policy Changes: Memos or correspondence discussing changes to conduct policies, disciplinary procedures, or related codes. 
27. Salary Records: Current and historical salary data for all personnel, including base pay, overtime, special assignment pay, and bonuses. 
I will be coordinating your records request with the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office (JCSO). My apologies for the very long estimate that was initially sent to you. I was out of town and one of the records staff at JCSO sent that estimate based on their perception of the size of your request. We do actually intend to produce records by installment as records are located, compiled and review is completed. A few of your request items are relatively simple and can correspondingly be produced relatively quickly. However, unless I'm misunderstanding any details, the overall scope of your request appears to be massive. I have taken the liberty of numbering each of the bulleted items in your request, for ease of reference. I would guess that 27 of your requests, taken together, comprise a significant portion, probably a majority, of all of JCSO's administrative records. Many of the requested records will require detailed review and redaction which is a time-consuming process. Some of the requested records will also require third party notice to be sent to subjects of the records, which will also add to the overall processing time for those records. Given limitations in personnel and the need to prevent excessive interference with other essential operations, it will take a period of many months to complete all 27 items of your request. But, as I mentioned, we will produce records by installment as they are compiled, prepared and reviewed. Some of the records you are requesting exist in paper files only. The county charges 10 cents a page for scans of paper records, so there will be some charges for certain installments along the way. The total cost of all charges will almost certainly be well in excess of $25. Each time we anticipate charges for a certain installment, we will first send you an estimate of the charges, showing an estimate of the number of pages to be scanned. We estimate that public records responsive to this request will be available within nine business days from today, on or before 5/30/2025. If public records become available in advance of this estimate we will contact you promptly. Conversely, if the County encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will contact you promptly with a revised estimated date. Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. Sincerely, Ken Hugoniot 
Public Records Administrator 
Central Services 
Jefferson County 
360-385-9174

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #S003598-042925
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Hugoniot,

Thank you for your detailed explanation regarding the scope and complexity of my public records request. I appreciate your transparency about the challenges involved, including the time required for review, redaction, and third-party notifications, as well as the potential costs associated with scanning paper records.
Understanding the broad nature of my request, I want to be mindful of limiting costs and minimizing any operational burden on Jefferson County. To that end, I would be happy to work with you to identify an initial set of 10–15 high-priority categories that can be compiled and released earlier in the process. If you could advise which of the requested items are more readily accessible or less resource-intensive to produce, that would help me focus the request accordingly. Additionally, I would appreciate it if you could provide a simple tracking update or log indicating the current status of each category as they move through review and preparation. This would help me monitor progress and plan accordingly.

Thank you again for your willingness to produce records on a rolling basis and for providing advance estimates of any anticipated charges. I look forward to receiving the first installment of records by May 30, 2025, or sooner if available, and to working collaboratively toward a transparent and timely resolution.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S003598-042925
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Hello Aurora, 
We have reviewed each of the items in your request and identified a few items which can be completed expeditiously. We have also identified some other items for which we have either no responsive records or very few responsive records. Unless you have any objection, we will process those requests first and then move on to larger and more time-consuming requests. The items we identified for this "first round" are numbers 
1, 3, 4, 10, 12, 13, 16, 17, 19, and 20. 
You asked for something like a tracking update or log to track the progress of each item.  The best way to approach this is to create a new request in our public records request system for each item when we begin working on it. These will be essentially sub-requests. The sub-requests will give both you and us an easy way to track the progress of each item. All of the records produced for an item will be stored in that item's sub-request and provided via the sub-request. Also all communication regarding each item, including time estimates for providing installments of records can also be conducted via the corresponding sub-request. All of the sub-requests will appear as individual requests in your account and each of them will have its own reference number that gets generated when it's entered. I'll be creating a few of these sub-requests today and you'll get an automatic acknowledgement email from each one as it's created. 
Please let me know if you have any questions or objections about any of this. 
Thank you, Ken Hugoniot 
Jefferson County Public Records Administrator 
1820 Jefferson St. 
Port Townsend, WA 98368 
(360) 385-9174 
khugoniot@co.jefferson.wa.us (mailto:khugoniot@co.jefferson.wa.us)

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #S003639-052225
communications.communication:
Subject: Refining Scope of Records Requests Before Proceeding

Dear Mr. Hugoniot,

Thank you for your earlier responses regarding my records requests. Before proceeding with payment or next steps, I would like to take time to refine the scope of the requested records to ensure clarity and reduce unnecessary time and cost for both parties.

I am currently reviewing the following 27 requested items and will be preparing a refined, tiered list identifying:
•	Which items apply to current employees only vs. former employees (and how many years back, e.g., last 3–10 years),
•	Which apply specifically to sworn officers vs. administrative staff,
•	Which categories should be prioritized first for delivery.

I also acknowledge that you have already provided:
•	The personnel roster of current employees (Item #1) via the Muckrock portal,
•	A formal response indicating no responsive records for Item #10 (Early Intervention System Data),
•	A formal response indicating no responsive records for Item #20 (Body-Worn Camera Misuse or Policy Violations).

While I reserve the right to revisit these items or seek administrative appeal later, if necessary, I will focus for now on refining the scope of the remaining requests. Please also note that I intend to process all communications and records delivery solely through the Muckrock portal to keep everything centralized. Once I finalize and submit the refined list, I will follow up regarding payment arrangements and next steps.

Thank you for your cooperation. I’ll be back in touch with you shortly.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

Dear Aurora  Quinn, Jefferson County Sheriff's Office received the following public records request from you on April 30, 2025: (4) Demographic Breakdown of Staff: Information regarding race, gender, age, and years of service for all personnel. 
Jefferson County has located records responsive to your request, which are being released to you electronically. The reports provided in response to this records request were produced by the county human resources department. At the beginning of 2022, the county migrated personnel data to a new database. There is one file containing information in the new database, from 2022 to the present. There are three other reports that capture data from the retired pre-2022 legacy database (GEMS). One of those reports (EEO4-GEMS_2015-2022) was generated for this records request from data that remains from the legacy database. The other two reports were previously generated in the legacy database in 2017 and 2015 and were located among files maintained by human resources. All four reports together represent all files and database information that are responsive to this request. Please log in to the Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve your responsive documents: Sheriff Public Records Request - S003641-052225 All responsive records have been produced and the request is now closed. This completes, closes, and provides Jefferson County's final, definitive response to this request. If you have any difficulty retrieving your documents, please contact me for assistance as soon as possible. Jefferson County will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so at your earliest opportunity. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #S003639-052225
communications.communication:
Subject: Refined Public Records Request – Tier 1 Items (Clarification and Follow-Up)

Dear Mr. Hugoniot,

Thank you again for your responses to my previous public records request. As part of the clarification and refinement process, I am writing to follow up only on the Tier 1 items that were identified for refinement. These items include: 1, 3, 4, 10, 12, 13, 16, 17, 19, and 20. My goal is to clarify these requests so they can be processed in a manner consistent with Jefferson County’s records practices and Washington’s Public Records Act. Additionally, I want to clarify that I am not using my personal email address for correspondence. All communications should continue through the MuckRock portal, where this request is being formally tracked.

Please see my refined requests below:

Item 1 – Personnel Rosters (Refined Request)
I received a spreadsheet labeled:
•	Personnel_Roster.Current_Employees
However, this request has not been fully fulfilled because:
•	Hire dates are missing for all current employees.
•	Official position descriptions are missing for all listed positions.
Please provide:
1.	The hire date for each individual listed in the current employee roster (this field is currently blank).
2.	The official position description for each unique rank/position title listed (e.g., Patrol Sergeant, Corrections Officer, Support Services Tech I/II, Animal Control Officer, etc.).
Position descriptions may be provided in the format used by Jefferson County Human Resources for job classifications or duty statements.

Item 3 – Internal Affairs Complaints Logs (Refined Request)
Please provide logs or records of complaints filed against sworn officers from January 1, 2015 to the present, including:
•	Date of complaint
•	Name(s) of officer(s) involved
•	Badge number(s)
•	Nature/type of complaint
•	Summary of allegations
•	Status and outcome
•	Date investigation closed
•	Disciplinary action taken (if any)
This applies to both current and former sworn officers employed during the time period. Records may be provided in spreadsheet or narrative form; whichever format includes all the above fields.

Item 4 – Demographic Breakdown of Staff (Refined Request)
Please provide a demographic breakdown of all current employees of the Jefferson County Sheriff’s Office, including:
•	Race/ethnicity
•	Gender
•	Age or age range
•	Rank/position title
Years of service may be included optionally. A summary table or anonymized dataset is acceptable if required for privacy.

Item 10 – Early Intervention System (EIS) Data (Clarification Request)
You stated there are no responsive records and that this is the “final, definitive response.”
To clarify, I am requesting:
1.	Whether Jefferson County Sheriff’s Office has ever maintained an Early Intervention System (EIS) or similar mechanism for identifying concerning officer behavior.
2.	Whether any policies, communications, or evaluations exist relating to EIS or comparable oversight systems.
3.	Confirmation that no such system or record has existed during the past 10 years, if applicable.
4.	A description of the search process used to determine no responsive records exist.

Item 12 – Grievance Records (Refined Request)
Please provide formal grievance records filed by or against current or former sworn personnel in the past 10 years, including:
•	Date of grievance
•	Nature of grievance
•	Names or job titles of parties involved
•	Investigation summaries (if available)
•	Final outcomes
A summary log is acceptable, but please include any related documents if maintained.

Item 13 – Supervisor Notes and Counseling Records (Refined Request)
Please provide supervisor notes or informal counseling records for current and former sworn personnel from the past 10 years, including:
•	Informal warnings
•	Supervisor memos or notes
•	Performance improvement plans (PIPs) not tied to formal discipline
•	Coaching documentation
If these records are not systematically maintained, please indicate so.

Item 16 – Off-Duty Misconduct Records (Refined Request)
Please provide records from the past 10 years involving off-duty misconduct by current or former sworn personnel, including:
•	Incident reports
•	Internal/external investigation documentation
•	Arrests, citations, or disciplinary findings
This includes off-duty conduct that triggered internal review or formal findings.

Item 17 – Records of Lawsuits Against Officers (Refined Request)
Please provide records of any lawsuits filed in the past 10 years involving current or former sworn personnel, including:
•	Officer names (if available)
•	Case summaries and allegations
•	Court docket numbers or identifiers
•	Final outcomes (settled, dismissed, adjudicated)
•	Any internal documentation tied to the case
If full case files are extensive, an index or summary table with references is sufficient.

Item 19 – Brady/Giglio List Records (Refined Request)
Please provide records from the past 10 years identifying current or former sworn personnel who:
•	Were flagged for credibility concerns
•	Were placed on a Brady or Giglio list
•	Were subject to notifications involving dishonesty or bias
This includes:
•	Notices to/from prosecutors
•	Internal documentation or summaries
•	Any determinations related to Brady/Giglio obligations
If the Sheriff’s Office does not maintain a Brady list internally, please confirm whether any correspondence or determinations exist from the Prosecutor’s Office.

Item 20 – Body-Worn Camera Misuse or Policy Violations (Refined Request)
You stated that there are no responsive records and that there have been no violations since the body-worn camera program began in 2022.
To ensure clarity and accountability, please provide:
1.	Any records of complaints, investigations, or disciplinary actions regarding body-worn camera misuse since 2022.
2.	Documentation of the search process used to confirm no records exist, including:
•	The staff members involved in the search
•	The methods and date(s) of the search
•	Any applicable policies related to BWC misuse
If no responsive records truly exist, that is understood, but I am requesting verification of the basis for the determination.

Please confirm receipt of this refined request and feel free to contact me via the MuckRock portal if you require clarification. Thank you for your time and assistance.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #S003639-052225
communications.communication:
Subject: Public Records Request — Refined Tier 2 and Tier 3 Items

Dear Mr. Hugoniot,

Thank you again for your assistance with my ongoing public records request. Following up on our prior communications, please find below the refined requests for Tier 2 and Tier 3 items. These refinements are intended to clarify exactly which records I am seeking, to help ensure the requests can be processed efficiently and in accordance with Jefferson County’s records practices and Washington’s Public Records Act.

Please note the following important points:
•	Some records may require third-party review or employee sign-off, which could delay processing.
•	You are welcome to release records as they become available or to reorder and prioritize the tiering as needed.
•	To help keep costs low and avoid unnecessary charges, please provide an itemized estimate of fees before incurring any costs.

Please see my refined requests below:

Tier 2 — Refined Requests

Item 5 – Disciplinary Records
Please provide records of any sustained misconduct findings for current and former sworn officers, including reprimands, suspensions, demotions, and terminations, with documentation of the nature of misconduct and disciplinary decisions.

Item 6 – Citizen Complaint Records
Please provide complaints filed by the public against sworn officers from January 1, 2015, to present, including investigation records, findings, and any resulting disciplinary actions. Applies to current and former sworn officers.

Item 7 – Officer Training Records
Please provide detailed training records for all current sworn officers, including certifications, course names, completion dates, and ongoing or refresher education.

Item 8 – Use of Force Reports
Please provide all reports documenting use of force incidents by sworn officers from January 1, 2015, to present, including type of force, dates, officer names and badge numbers, and circumstances. Includes current and former sworn officers.

Item 9 – Officer-Involved Shooting Reports
Please provide investigative files and administrative reviews related to officer-involved shootings, including internal and external investigations and outcomes, for current and former sworn officers.

Item 11 – Performance Evaluations
Please provide performance evaluations for current and former sworn officers, including narrative comments, ratings, and recommendations.

Item 14 – Resignation and Retirement Records
Please provide records detailing reasons for resignations or retirements of sworn officers, especially related to critical incidents or disciplinary matters, including dates and accompanying documentation.

Item 15 – Awards and Commendations
Please provide records of awards, commendations, or honors given to sworn officers, including dates, types, and reasons for recognition.

Tier 3 — Refined Requests

Item 18 – Settlement Agreements Involving Officers
Please provide full terms and details of settlement agreements involving sworn officers, including any confidentiality or non-disclosure provisions.

Item 21 – Records of Transfers and Reassignments
Please provide records regarding transfers or reassignments of sworn officers, including reasons and effective dates, for current and former sworn officers.

Item 22 – Fitness-for-Duty Evaluations
Please provide psychological or medical evaluation records conducted as fitness-for-duty assessments triggered by misconduct or other events for sworn officers.

Item 23 – Promotions and Demotions Records
Please provide application materials, evaluation records, and decision memorandums related to promotions and demotions of sworn officers, including dates and justifications.

Item 24 – Employment Application Materials
Please provide initial employment applications, resumes, and background check summaries for sworn officers only, redacted as necessary for privacy.

Item 25 – Secondary Employment Approvals
Please provide records showing agency approval for secondary employment by sworn officers, including application dates and approval status.

Item 26 – Internal Memos Regarding Conduct Policy Changes
Please provide memos or correspondence discussing changes to conduct policies, disciplinary procedures, or codes of conduct.

Item 27 – Salary Records
Please provide current and historical salary data for sworn officers, including base pay, overtime, special assignment pay, and bonuses.

Please confirm receipt of this refined request. I appreciate your time and assistance. Feel free to contact me through the MuckRock portal if you require clarification.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

Hello Aurora, 
Thank you for your detailed clarification email. Could I ask you to please forward a copy of the email to my general email address for public records requests? publicrecords@co.jefferson.wa.us (mailto://publicrecords@co.jefferson.wa.us) 
Emails received in the public records center have all the formatting stripped from them, so it is difficult to read and parse a long and detailed email such as the one you just sent. Additionally, for communication that requires a lot of attention to detail, it's more efficient for our clerical and documentation needs 
You should be able to send a copy of the email through the muckrock portal (maybe by sending a reply to the email from publicrecords@co.jefferson.wa.us, which I sent to you via the muckrock address last week). You do not need to send any communication from your personal email address. 
Thank you, Ken Hugoniot 
Jefferson County Public Records Administrator 
1820 Jefferson St. 
Port Townsend, WA 98368 
(360) 385-9174 
khugoniot@co.jefferson.wa.us (mailto:khugoniot@co.jefferson.wa.us)

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #S003639-052225
communications.communication:
Subject: Follow-Up on Refined Public Records Requests (Tiers 1, 2, and 3)

Dear Mr. Hugoniot,

Thank you for your response and for explaining your internal formatting concerns. For clarity and efficiency, I am submitting a clean, easy-to-read version of my refined Tier 1, Tier 2, and Tier 3 requests directly through this MuckRock portal.

Please note that my refined requests were formally submitted through MuckRock on June 15, 2025 (Tier 1) and June 16, 2025 (Tiers 2 and 3). Under RCW 42.56, submission through MuckRock satisfies the requirement for making a public records request, and I expect the response timelines under the Public Records Act to be based on those submission dates.

While I appreciate your preference for alternate formatting, this formal submission through MuckRock should be sufficient for processing. Please confirm that processing is underway and that the agency’s statutory obligations are being met.

Below are the refined requests:


Tier 1 – Refined Requests

Item 1 – Personnel Rosters
Please provide:

1. The hire date for each individual listed in the current employee roster.
2. The official position description for each unique rank/position title listed (e.g., Patrol Sergeant, Corrections Officer, Support Services Tech I/II, Animal Control Officer, etc.).

Item 3 – Internal Affairs Complaints Logs
Please provide logs or records of complaints filed against sworn officers from January 1, 2015 to the present, including:

* Date of complaint
* Name(s) of officer(s) involved
* Badge number(s)
* Nature/type of complaint
* Summary of allegations
* Status and outcome
* Date investigation closed
* Disciplinary action taken (if any)

Item 4 – Demographic Breakdown of Staff
Please provide a demographic breakdown of all current employees, including:

* Race/ethnicity
* Gender
* Age or age range
* Rank/position title

Item 10 – Early Intervention System (EIS) Data
Please provide:

1. Whether the office has ever maintained an Early Intervention System or similar mechanism.
2. Whether any policies, communications, or evaluations exist related to this.
3. Confirmation if no such system or record has existed in the past 10 years.
4. A description of the search process used to determine no responsive records exist.

Item 12 – Grievance Records
Please provide formal grievance records filed by or against current or former sworn personnel in the past 10 years, including:

* Date of grievance
* Nature of grievance
* Names or job titles of involved parties
* Investigation summaries
* Final outcomes

Item 13 – Supervisor Notes and Counseling Records
Please provide supervisor notes or informal counseling records for current and former sworn personnel from the past 10 years, including:

* Informal warnings
* Supervisor memos or notes
* PIPs not tied to formal discipline
* Coaching documentation

Item 16 – Off-Duty Misconduct Records
Please provide records from the past 10 years involving off-duty misconduct by current or former sworn personnel, including:

* Incident reports
* Internal/external investigation documentation
* Arrests, citations, or disciplinary findings

Item 17 – Records of Lawsuits Against Officers
Please provide records of any lawsuits filed in the past 10 years involving current or former sworn personnel, including:

* Officer names (if available)
* Case summaries and allegations
* Court docket numbers
* Final outcomes
* Any internal documentation tied to the case

Item 19 – Brady/Giglio List Records
Please provide records from the past 10 years identifying current or former sworn personnel who:

* Were flagged for credibility concerns
* Were placed on a Brady or Giglio list
* Were subject to dishonesty/bias notifications

Item 20 – Body-Worn Camera Misuse or Policy Violations
Please provide:

1. Any records of complaints, investigations, or disciplinary actions regarding misuse since 2022.
2. Documentation of the search process used to confirm no records exist.


Tier 2 – Refined Requests

Item 5 – Disciplinary Records
Please provide records of sustained misconduct findings for current and former sworn officers, including reprimands, suspensions, demotions, terminations, nature of misconduct, and disciplinary decisions.

Item 6 – Citizen Complaint Records
Please provide complaints filed by the public against sworn officers from January 1, 2015, to present, including investigation records, findings, and any disciplinary actions.

Item 7 – Officer Training Records
Please provide detailed training records for all current sworn officers, including certifications, course names, completion dates, and refresher education.

Item 8 – Use of Force Reports
Please provide reports documenting use of force by sworn officers from January 1, 2015, to present, including type of force, dates, officer names/badge numbers, circumstances.

Item 9 – Officer-Involved Shooting Reports
Please provide investigative files and administrative reviews of officer-involved shootings for current/former sworn officers.

Item 11 – Performance Evaluations
Please provide performance evaluations for current and former sworn officers, including comments, ratings, recommendations.

Item 14 – Resignation and Retirement Records
Please provide records detailing reasons for resignations or retirements of sworn officers, especially related to critical incidents.

Item 15 – Awards and Commendations
Please provide records of awards or honors given to sworn officers, including dates, types, reasons.


Tier 3 – Refined Requests

Item 18 – Settlement Agreements Involving Officers
Please provide terms and details of settlements involving sworn officers, including confidentiality provisions.

Item 21 – Records of Transfers and Reassignments
Please provide records of transfers or reassignments of sworn officers, including reasons and effective dates.

Item 22 – Fitness-for-Duty Evaluations
Please provide fitness-for-duty evaluation records for sworn officers.

Item 23 – Promotions and Demotions Records
Please provide application materials, evaluations, decision memos related to promotions/demotions, dates, justifications.

Item 24 – Employment Application Materials
Please provide initial employment applications, resumes, background summaries for sworn officers.

Item 25 – Secondary Employment Approvals
Please provide records showing agency approval for secondary employment by sworn officers.

Item 26 – Internal Memos Regarding Conduct Policy Changes
Please provide memos or correspondence about changes to conduct policies or disciplinary procedures.

Item 27 – Salary Records
Please provide current and historical salary data for sworn officers, including base pay, overtime, bonuses.


Thank you for your time and assistance. Please confirm receipt of this refined request through this MuckRock portal, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

Sincerely,

Aurora Quinn

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 30, 2025, Reference # S003639-052225. Dear Aurora  Quinn, Jefferson County Sheriff's Office received the following public records request from you on April 30, 2025: (1) Personnel Rosters: Full list of current and former officers and staff, including names, badge numbers, 
ranks/positions, assignments, hiring dates, lengths of service, and current salaries. 
The official position description for each unique rank/position title listed (e.g., Patrol Sergeant, Corrections Officer, Support Services Tech I/II, Animal Control Officer, etc.). 
Jefferson County Sheriff's Office has located records responsive to your request, which are being released to you electronically. We have provided all official job descriptions for JCSO. Please note that the job title, "Detective", is included within the "Deputy Sheriff" description and the job title, "Detective Sergeant" is included within the Sergeant of Patrol description. The Clerk Hires are part time employees and there are no official job descriptions for their positions. You also mentioned that we had not included hire dates for current employees. However, hire dates were included in the current employees personnel roster that we provided earlier. Please log in to the Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve your responsive documents: Sheriff Public Records Request - S003639-052225  All responsive records have been produced and the request is now closed. This completes, closes, and provides Jefferson County's final, definitive response to this request. If you have any difficulty retrieving your documents, please contact me for assistance as soon as possible. Jefferson County will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so at your earliest opportunity. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S003642-052225
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 30, 2025, Reference # S003642-052225 Dear Aurora  Quinn, The County received the following public records request from you on April 30, 2025: (19) Brady/Giglio List Records 
Please provide records from the past 10 years identifying current or former sworn personnel who: 
* Were flagged for credibility concerns 
* Were placed on a Brady or Giglio list 
* Were subject to dishonesty/bias notifications 
The first installment of records responsive to your request is available to you now in the Jefferson County Public Records Center. The Jefferson County Prosecuting Attorney's Office (PAO) provided two versions of their Brady list. The list in PDF format is the currently used list which is more up to date. The Excel spreadsheet version is the previously-used version which is no longer kept up to date, but it contains some information that is not included in the current list. The PAO issues potential impeachment disclosure (PID) letters pertaining to both Jefferson County Sheriff officers and Port Townsend Police Department officers, so those are included in the responsive records. Please log in at the following link to retrieve your responsive records: Sheriff Public Records Request - S003642-052225  These may be all of the responsive records, but it appears that there is at least one PID letter missing. I will need to inquire with the PAO regarding any remaining unlocated records. Meanwhile, if you have any additional questions or issues pertaining to the records produced in this installment, please don't hesitate to contact me. If any additional records are located, we estimate the next installment to this request will be available within five business days from today, on or before 7/11/2025. If you experience any difficulties accessing the Public Records Center or downloading your documents, please contact me as soon as possible for assistance. Sincerely, Ken Hugoniot 
Public Records Administrator 
Central Services 
Jefferson County 
360-385-9174

communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S003640-052225
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 30, 2025, Reference # S003640-052225. Dear Aurora  Quinn, Jefferson County Sheriff's Office received the following public records request from you on April 30, 2025: (3) Internal Affairs Complaints Logs 
Please provide logs or records of complaints filed against sworn officers from January 1, 2015 to the present, including: 
* Date of complaint 
* Name(s) of officer(s) involved 
* Badge number(s) 
* Nature/type of complaint 
* Summary of allegations 
* Status and outcome 
* Date investigation closed 
* Disciplinary action taken (if any) 
In response to your records request, Jefferson County Sheriff's Office has provided the full internal affairs log that is maintained by their office. The log includes all types of internal affairs incidents combined in one table. In addition to complaints the log includes use of force incidents, pursuits, workplace injuries and equipment/vehicle damage incidents. The log does not include: 
Badge number 
Date investigation closed The disposition column contains a small amount of information about disciplinary action taken for investigations that were upheld, but the information doesn't appear to be entirely consistent. For current employees, badge numbers can be located by cross-referencing employee names from the IA log with names in the current employee roster, which I've included in the downloads with the IA log file. Since the records of all investigations will be provided to you in response to other items in your overall records request, those documents will include all the details of the investigations, including the date that the investigations were closed and any disciplinary action that was taken. Please log in to the Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve your responsive documents: Sheriff Public Records Request - S003640-052225  All responsive records have been produced and the request is now closed. This completes, closes, and provides Jefferson County's final, definitive response to this request. If you have any difficulty retrieving your documents, please contact me for assistance as soon as possible. Jefferson County will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so at your earliest opportunity. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. Sincerely, Ken Hugoniot 
Public Records Administrator 
Central Services 
Jefferson County 
360-385-9174

title: Evergreen Solutions (Onondaga County)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Onondaga County)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

Greetings, 

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you. 

Staff Census Information requested: 

Job Titles 
Classification Title 
Pay Grades 
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum) 
Actual Salaries 
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status 
Staff Handbook 

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study: 

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)? 
What is your current turnover rate? 
What is your current average tenure for an employee? 
Date your current compensation plan was implemented. 
Date of the last salary adjustment? 
How frequently are job descriptions updated? 

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information: 

Faculty Census: 
Rank (if applicable) 
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc) 
Highest Degree Held 
Pay Grade 
Pay Ranges (Min& Max) 
Current Step (if on a step plan) 
Contract Length (in days and/or months) 
Annual Base Salary with no additives 
Annual Salary with any additives 
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology) 
Department 
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent) 

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available: 

Copy of all faculty pay plans 
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc) 
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc) 
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements 
Current Turnover Rate 
Current Average Tenure 
Date that your current pay plan was implemented 
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan 
How frequently are your job descriptions updated 
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount? 
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction 
Faculty Handbooks 
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan 
Overload Rates 
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs 
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details. 
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details. 
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details. 

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal. 

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me. 

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated. 

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes 
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #F000125-030625
communications.communication:
Greetings,

I hope this finds you well. Apologies for the confusion and delay. Please see the response to your questions below:

1) the date range of your request, or if you are looking for current information only; 

- Looking for current information, or if it is not updated, the most recent.

2) what collect bargaining agreements you are requesting

- staff agreements, handbooks, policies things of that nature as well as job descriptions, pay plan and a staff census

 3) if you are looking for current information only .
- yes, if not current, most recent.

Thank you

This email is a follow-up to our email dated June 12, 2025, in which we advised we would do our best to process your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request by June 30, 2025. We are in the process of responding to your FOIL request, however, we will need another estimated seven (7) business days from today expiring July 9, 2025, as we are still reviewing the responsive documents for possible redactions.   Your patience is very much appreciated. "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

To Whom It May Concern: 

Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings, 

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. Staff Handbook

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Department Of Agriculture, Office of the Secretary)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Department Of Agriculture, Office of the Secretary)
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Department Of Agriculture, Office of the Secretary,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to U.S. Department Of Agriculture, Office of the Secretary's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: FOIA acknowledgment #2025-OGC-01263-F
communications.communication:
Dear Sai:

This email acknowledges receipt of your attached Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s (USDA), Office of Information Affairs, FOIA Division (OIA-FOIA). Your request was received by this office on October 24, 2024.

The OIA-FOIA is under the purview of the General Counsel (GC) and serves as the focal point for USDA’s FOIA program. It provides coordination and ensures agency-wide compliance with the FOIA. Additionally, the OIA-FOIA processes requests and appeals on behalf of the Office of the Secretary (OSEC); the Under Secretaries; USDA’s staff offices; and the Research, Education and Economics and Trade and Foreign Agricultural Affairs mission areas.

The FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), requires USDA to make a determination in response to a FOIA request within 20 business days from its date of receipt. In unusual circumstances, the Federal agency time limit may be extended by 10 business days as stated in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If your request seeks numerous records that will necessitate a wide-ranging search, including searches with components and possible consultations with components that have a substantial interest in the determination of this request, USDA will invoke a 10 business day extension for determination of your request. You have the option to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records.

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Pursuant to USDA FOIA Regulations, Title 7 CFR §1.6(a), the USDA processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.

Provisions of the FOIA allow USDA to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. For purposes of fee assessment, you have been categorized as an ”news media” requester, pursuant to 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1 Section 2(b)(4)(i). For your review and information, a copy of the USDA FOIA Fee Schedule is attached. In accordance with 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section 3(b), your fees shall be waived where the amount of the fee is $25.00 or less.

You have requested a fee waiver. Your request is under consideration.

A search will be conducted for records responsive to your request. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that a FOIA analyst will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.

Your request has been assigned FOIA Case No. 2024-OGC-01263-F. Please refer to this case number in any future correspondence. If you have any questions regarding the processing of this request, please contact Mr. Harald Fuller-Bennett at 202-239-4522 or electronically at harald.fullerbennett@usda.gov<mailto:harald.fullerbennett@usda.gov> or USDAFOIA@usda.gov<mailto:USDAFOIA@usda.gov>. For additional information regarding USDA FOIA regulations and process, please refer to the information available on-line at Freedom of Information Act Division | USDA.

We appreciate the opportunity to assist you.

Sincerely,

Office of Information Affairs

Freedom of Information Act Division

[cid:image001.png@01DB2623.7D7E9480]
Harald Fuller-Bennett (he/his)
Government Information Specialist
Office of Information Affairs
US Department of Agriculture
1400 Independence Ave. SW, Room 4041
Washington, DC  20250
☎   202-239-4522 (Desk)
📱   202-809-7889 (Mobile)
📠   844-288-3373 (Fax)
✉   Harald.FullerBennett@usda.gov<mailto:Harald.FullerBennett@usda.gov>













This electronic message contains information generated by the USDA solely for the intended recipients. Any unauthorized interception of this message or the use or disclosure of the information it contains may violate the law and subject the violator to civil or criminal penalties. If you believe you have received this message in error, please notify the sender and delete the email immediately.

title: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Fontana Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Fontana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

- Records and data that outlines what was purchased using money from the fund, including dates, descriptions, and total spent. 

- Any annual reports produced civil asset forfeiture program.

- Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the department Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the department

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.
 
The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (United States Secret Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (United States Secret Service)
communications.communication:
Dear United States Secret Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to United States Secret Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Florida Public Records Request – Arrest of Brandon St. Gerard (October 3, 2024, Hollywood, FL)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida Public Records Request – Arrest of Brandon St. Gerard (October 3, 2024, Hollywood, FL)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, I request unredacted digital copies of all video footage related to the arrest of Brandon St. Gerard, age 29, on October 3, 2024, by Broward Sheriff’s Office detectives.

According to public reports, St. Gerard was a UPS employee suspected of stealing over $67,000 in electronics, including iPhones, AirPods, and an Apple Watch, from a UPS facility in Hollywood, Florida. He was arrested after running a stop sign while under surveillance and subsequently confessed to the theft.

Please include all body-worn camera, dashcam, and interior patrol vehicle footage related to the traffic stop, arrest, and transport to the Broward County Main Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Police News, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Broward County Sheriff Public Records Center. If you have never used this system, your account has been created by a staff person at Broward County Sheriff's Office. 
 
Once your email address has been verified, you can log in to the Public Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 
 Login: 187336-64591240@requests.muckrock.com 
 
To verify your email address, the following activation link to set a password will be active for 24 hours. 
 Activate Online Account 
 
If the activation link expires, you will need to request a password by clicking the link below. This will allow you to access your request, manage account information, and retrieve responsive records. 
 
 Request a Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXcG3Wr1V145KpTsNEi9u7JfrXFsT6tourVE6ng05QNQK4uy3nDLpKgYAvkV9FO7eZXyWQHxUzJMyiZfdhujTm38-3DsNHj_8EWO2vnp78FwwRzl8EJIlO2bqzK7kCj1aBPE5ljO4wyOWy5jLHh1fFdltlpOF7Kc7KUNt2DT0OyVxuv0iRCl6mMdn44LFga0XAmsrtZH9LJJKrLJrpE1e-2BC0C2P3ukUGp9WR1Zv0-2Fx9p5JWiwq0X-2FIgJHZYwAaYwnFQXEsI-2BxfNWHsCA3-2Fg-2BmJ4LB7j0syfj9FV4LqOX5PthauP4OJPcJh-2FoBku6nONvTnHoW61uOTU-3D) 
 PLEASE NOTE: All requests are completed in the order they are received. Please understand some requests may take more than a week to fulfill. If a request takes a large amount of time to complete, then an estimate will be sent to you and a deposit or full payment may be required. When an invoice is sent to you for payment, payment must be received immediately.  If payment is not received in an allotted amount of time we will freeze all future requests until all unpaid invoices are paid in full and up to date. (refer to FSS: 119.07 (4)(d). If a request is no longer needed please contact our office immediately.  If the request is fulfilled before we are notified that the documents are no longer necessary, then payment must still be made for our time and efforts. If you plan to pick up your request please contact us in advance. 
 
Thank you, 
 Broward County Sheriff's Office This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

According to public reports, St. Gerard was a UPS employee suspected of stealing over $67,000 in electronics, including iPhones, AirPods, and an Apple Watch, from a UPS facility in Hollywood, Florida. He was arrested after running a stop sign while under surveillance and subsequently confessed to the theft.

The Broward Sheriff’s Office is committed to providing records as quickly and efficiently as possible. Please note, as a result of an increase in workload and current staffing, our unit is experiencing a backlog of requests for public records. We appreciate your patience as we’re working diligently to fulfill requests in the order in which they are received. Please DO NOT make a duplicate request for a copy of your report/record as this could further delay the turnaround time. 
 
Thank you. 
 
Broward Sheriff's Office 
Public Records Unit

 To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records: 

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, I request unredacted digital copies of all video footage related to the arrest of Brandon St. Gerard, age 29, on October 3, 2024, by Broward Sheriff’s Office detectives. 

According to public reports, St. Gerard was a UPS employee suspected of stealing over $67,000 in electronics, including iPhones, AirPods, and an Apple Watch, from a UPS facility in Hollywood, Florida. He was arrested after running a stop sign while under surveillance and subsequently confessed to the theft. 

Please include all body-worn camera, dashcam, and interior patrol vehicle footage related to the traffic stop, arrest, and transport to the Broward County Main Jail. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, 

Police Cam News 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbroward-county-sheriff-782%252Fflorida-public-records-request-arrest-of-brandon-st-gerard-october-3-2024-hollywood-fl-187336%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAbyrwObOfNC4kTXxqOtoKGgyY%3A1uM2Ns%3AQ_VgugdTNLwG8L1gFNNZgUepKg0qqW9XMrYLiUVFQc4 
 
Your report is currently being reviewed for Florida statutory exempt information. Any exempt information will be redacted at that time. We will be in contact when the review is complete. 
 
Thank you. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Public Records Unit

title: FBI support for 2022 Paramount+ documentary series "11 Minutes"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2022 Paramount+ documentary series "11 Minutes"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2022 Paramount+ documentary series "11 Minutes." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "11 Minutes," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "11 Minutes."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
