title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Office Of The Federal Register)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Office Of The Federal Register)
communications.communication:
Dear Office Of The Federal Register,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Office Of The Federal Register's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Office Of The Federal Register)
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Office of the Federal Register (OFR).  

*If you are a Federal Register liaison officer or agency drafter, contact the Scheduling Unit (contact information located in the DDH) or visit our new agency resource page: https://www.archives.gov/agencies. *

If you have a question about our office or one of our publications (and it is not already answered by one or more of the following links), we will respond within 10 business days.  
  -  For comments (how to comment; how to find a comment) on a document published in the Federal Register (DO NOT send us the comment): https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#comments

  -  For questions about specific documents in the Federal Register or content in the CFR: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#fr-pubs

  -  For problems with your myFR or myCFR account or to report a problem with FederalRegister.gov or eCFR.gov: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#tech 

  -  For questions about Presidential documents: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#pres-docs

  -  For questions about public laws and the U.S. Statutes at Large: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#laws

  -  To report a legal violation or crime: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#doc-qs

  -  To inspect IBR material (we do NOT provide copies), email the complete CFR citation and full description of the material to fr.inspection@nara.gov

Neither FederalRegister.gov nor eCFR.gov independently links to outside interests and we do not accept or respond to solicitations.

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Office Of The Federal Register)
communications.communication:
Dear Sai,

The Office of the Federal Register (OFR) does not have a dedicated FOIA
office nor does it have a dedicated FOIA mailbox.  The OFR has two
attorneys who process some FOIA requests pertaining to our office as "other
duties as assigned" and support the National Archives and Records
Administration's (NARA's) Office of General Counsel when appropriate.  NARA
does have a dedicated FOIA officer and dedicated FOIA mailbox.

If you intended to address your request to the OFR, I need clarification.
Do you want us to interpret your request as applying only to FOIA requests
received and replied to? Or do you want us to find responsive emails from
any box that receives FOIA requests along with all other public and agency
correspondence?


Respectfully,



Miriam Vincent

*Miriam Vincent (she/her)   *
*Senior Staff Attorney |  **Legal Affairs and Policy **    |    **Office of
the Federal Register*
miriam.vincent@nara.gov | mvincent@gpo.gov
*NARA mobile: 202.695.9791  |  **GPO mobile: 202.276.3219 |  **Office/VM:
202.741.6024*
*National Archives and Records Administration*

Agency FAQs: archives.gov/federal-register/agencies/agency-questions
<https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/agencies/agency-questions>
General Public FAQs: archives.gov/federal-register/faqs
<https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Office Of The Federal Register)
communications.communication:
Dear Miriam,

Thank you for your very prompt email, and for your unusually clear clarification request. (A bit ironic, but most clarification requests are extremely unclear.)

Please interpret the request by considering "chief FOIA officer" to refer to the one of your two OFR FOIA-processing attorneys who is more senior, or if they are equal, the one who does the most FOIA processing. The three email requests are based on the officer that refers to, "regardless of subject matter" — so it's just the 3 dated inbox, spam, & sent emails to/from that attorney's primary email used for OFR purposes, not specific to FOIA requests nor FOIA request email boxes.

Sincerely,
Sai

If you have a question about our office or one of our publications (and it is not already answered by one or more of the following links), we will respond within 10 business days.

  -  For questions about specific documents in the Federal Register or content in the CFR: https://www.archives.gov/federal-register/faqs#fr-pubs

title: Disciplinary Statistics

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Disciplinary Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records containing the following statistics for the academic years indicated:

1. Number of Honor Court Complaints or referrals (by source, such as cadet, faculty, staff, other, if possible) to the VMI Honor Court by academic year, race, ethnic background, and gender (further broken out by race and ethnic background), also identified as athlete or non-athlete.

2. Number of the Honor Court Complaints in #1 that were investigated by the same demographic breakdown.

3. Number of Honor Court Investigations in #2 that where Honor Court Charges were referred to the Superintendent for trial by the same demographic breakdown and indicated as approved for further action or disapproved by the Superintendent by the same demographic Breakdown.

4. Number of Cadets charged by the Honor Court whose charges were dismissed by the Superintendent based on pre-trial motions or for other reasons (with reasons if available) by the same demographic Breakdown.

5. Number of Cadets charged by the Honor Court who pleaded guilty to the charges by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

6. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court and found innocent by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

7. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court, Found Guilty and dismissed by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

8. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court, Found Guilty, whose cases the Superintendent subsequently dismissed and allowed them to stay at VMI by the same demographic Breakdown.

9. Number of Honor Court Cases where the Honor Court charged cadets but the Superintendent used his authority to adjudicate the case while the Corps was away from VMI (Summer Break, Furloughs, etc.) under the authority granted to him by the changes to the Honor System to make it more equitable by the exact demographic Breakdown.

10. Number of Honor Court Convictions appealed to the Board of Visitors Appeals Committee, and the result (appeal granted or denied) by the same demographic breakdown.

Data requested for the following Academic Years

2019 - 2020
2020 - 2021
2021 - 2022
2022 - 2023
2023 - 2024
2024 - 2025

Previously, similar statistics were made public through the media and the Barnes and Thornburg Investigation report before the requested years. The outgoing VMI Superintendent highlighted his accomplishments in ensuring racial equity, specifically for Black cadets. Still, the VMI Board of Visitors has not released his performance data in response to questions raised regarding their decision not to renew his contract. Other public documents contain statements regarding his successful efforts to provide personal oversight, review in these areas, and offenses, and prevent biased application of disciplinary actions (particularly against Black Cadets) to ensure equity. This updated data is relevant for the public to know the impact of his involvement in these areas identified as issues in the investigation.

This request is specifically NOT requesting any Personally Identifying Information (PII) on any of the individuals involved. VMI no longer announces the names of cadets dismissed for Honor Violations and those involved in Honor Court Cases are strictly prohibited from disclosing the the identities of these cadets, so there is no situation where this general information, which it is reasonably expected must be maintained to meet the committments to equity in the One Corps, One VMI Plan, responses to the Barnes and Thornburg Report, and VMI's repeated Committment to making changes to the honor ssystem so it is more equitable woudl violated any current or former cadet's privacy.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

The response you sent only included records up to AY 2020 - 2021.  THEY ARE MISSING AY 2022 - 2023, AY 2023 - 2024, AY 2024 - 2025. - PLEASE SEND THEM.

Also this is missing some of the other information I requested such as the number of cases referred for trial that the Superintendent dismissed either before trial or after conviction with the same demographic breakdown.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #25-82
communications.communication:
To confirm and avoid any misinterpretation of your response, that "no public body shall be required to create a new record if the record does not already exist. 

1. Are you stipulating that no such Honor Court Records or statistics exist for  AY 2022 - 2023, AY 2023 - 2024, AY 2024 - 2025?

2. Are you stipulating that no such Honor Court Records or statistics exist of the number of cases referred for trial that the Superintendent dismissed either before trial or after conviction, with the exact demographic breakdown?

I agree that an agency is not required to create a record if it does not exist, but I want to just confirm that no records responsive to #1 and #2 exist, and no records equivalent to those released existfor AY 2022 - 2023, AY 2023 - 2024, AY 2024 - 2025.

I look forward to your confirmation so I can close this matter on our end.

title: Lyndon LaRouche

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Lyndon LaRouche
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All files mentioning Lyndon LaRouche (September 8, 1922 – February 12, 2019), whose death has been widely reported.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Lyndon LaRouche

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email

foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Kentucky Public School Teacher Salaries (2018-2024)

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky Public School Teacher Salaries (2018-2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Annual electronic listing of all employees of the Kentucky Public School System from January 01, 2018 to December 31, 2024. Specifically, I am seeking electronic payroll/salary information for all individuals employed within all public schools and their districts for all fiscal years during this period. 

For each year and payroll, I am seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) [not paper records or a PDF created from data] with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, job title and code, subjects taught, school level (K-12, kindergarten, etc.), teaching certificates, measure of teaching quality (teacher evaluations of value-added of teacher), employment status (full-time/part-time/leave of absence), hire date or years of experiences, termination date, contract type (contracted/regular/temporary/student employee), and gross annual salary. If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables. 

In addition, please include any lookup tables that may be needed to interpret the data. For example, if school districts or job titles are listed with codes linked to a separate table, I will be happy to join the records myself, rather than require your staff to do so. 

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc). 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kaleb Houle-Lawrence

title: IPRA Request – August 3, 2023 Pursuit and Arrest of Steven Jimenez in Pecos, NM

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of the following public records related to the August 3, 2023 vehicle and foot pursuit of Steven Jimenez by New Mexico State Police in Pecos, NM:

All body-worn camera footage from NMSP officers involved in the pursuit, vehicle contact, foot chase, and arrest of Steven Jimenez.

All dash camera footage from NMSP vehicles engaged in the pursuit and contact with Jimenez’s vehicle.

Any aerial footage (e.g., drone or helicopter) captured during the incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: Public Safety - Public Records Request :: P058057-062025
communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock News: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of NMDPS. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of New Mexico Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 6/20/2025 and given the reference number P058057-062025 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
I am requesting access to and copies of the following public records related to the August 3, 2023 vehicle and foot pursuit of Steven Jimenez by New Mexico State Police in Pecos, NM:
All body-worn camera footage from NMSP officers involved in the pursuit, vehicle contact, foot chase, and arrest of Steven Jimenez.
All dash camera footage from NMSP vehicles engaged in the pursuit and contact with Jimenez’s vehicle.
Any aerial footage (e.g., drone or helicopter) captured during the incident.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek, and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability of records, and/or provided with copies of the records in question within 15 days. 
Any responsive records will be provided immediately if records have been located, they are public records, and there is no associated charge. Otherwise, within 15 days of your request, you will be notified if the DPS has encountered difficulties responding to your request, and provided the DPS’ estimate of when you will receive any records located. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
NMDPS To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXXZCf8Wwed0SEyv5G3b9BZCMNGGWcn92fh5JT78JlgCrgoUG1nyNRBEuASSQEgkUAg-3D-3DzPCh_zZq-2Bn-2FXKdjvz8ZP2GRFqdgX-2FBsqawtxZ3t4xgYHesU3CY3VdHrvYP0yrp616gyfkh02GQJcm0eJDpC8JSJ-2FRzv7UXhOz-2B4Lbx99wg34gIdlaWBIld6FI093MJw70r9nCMSnTpjilaR0A9QaHyJhKspBJaCHNcsfdV9vwokHG7u-2B4HzQNV82wmPHO2Fkycd90NHI55tHxgF-2FT4NZw-2F6y-2BsXyX-2FXQq75RK32i0QcUvxHY-3D)

title: Ryan Walters communications re: Freedom From Religion Foundation

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Ryan Walters communications re: Freedom From Religion Foundation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communications sent or received by Ryan Walters on or after January 1, 2024, which mention "Freedom From Religion" or "FFRF".

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Municipal investments (City Recorder)

communications.subject: GRAMA Request: Municipal investments (City Recorder)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Utah’s Government Records Access and Management Act (“GRAMA”), I hereby request the following records:

• A list of all Investment Management firms, Public Equity managers, public fixed-income account managers, or similar stock, bond, securities, and investment managers or management firms responsible for holdings, trading, or other manipulations of assets held by this agency or any division thereof, including any associated pension funds. If further clarification is necessary, please feel free to be in touch. I can be reached in the MuckRock office at 617-299-1832.

• A list of all asset holdings by this agency or any division thereof, including any associated departments or funds. Please include all available segregable data, including, but not limited to, the company, the associated call symbol, the number of shares, and the value of said shares. Please include the following elements for the holdings, if available. If any elements are not readily available, please feel free to disregard their collection.

Asset Category Description
Asset Type Description
Mellon Security ID
Comprehensive Annual Financial Report Name
Source Account Name
Security Description1
Holdings As Of Date
Base Cost
Base Market Value
Cusip
Security Description2
Moody Quality Rating - Non GRS
S&P Quality Rating - Non GRS
Asset Type Code
Position Type
Base Currency Code
Local Currency Code
Local Currency Description
Country Of Registration Code
Country Of Registration Name
Shares
Local Cost
Base Net Income Receivable
Local Net Income Receivable
Local Market Value
Coupon Rate
Maturity Date
Base Unrealized Gain/Loss
Local Unrealized Gain Loss
Base Unrealized Currency G/L Income
Reporting Account Status
ISIN
Sedol
Ticker

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: GRAMA Request: Municipal Investments
communications.communication:
Lindon City does not currently use, nor has the city ever used any investment management firms, public equity managers, public-fixed income account managers, or any other stock, bond, securities, or investment managers.

The funds that we do not have an immediate need for are placed with the Utah Public Treasurers' Investment Fund (PTIF). On the PTIF website it states "The PTIF invests primarily in investment-grade corporate notes, top tier commercial paper, and money market mutual funds." The site also has quarterly PTIF statistics. I have attached the 1st quarter statistics for 2025, with the knowledge that our funds only make up a fraction of PTIF fund as a whole

Our current balance with PTIF is $13,612,858.20.

Thank you!

Hayden Peterson, FPC
Lindon City Treasurer
hpeterson@lindon.gov<mailto:hpeterson@lindon.gov>

100 N. State Street
Lindon, UT 84042
(801) 785-5043
www.lindon.gov<http://www.lindon.gov/>

title: Cadet Rank Announcements

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Cadet Rank Announcements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Cadet rank announcements or other records with a breakout by race, gender, and athlete vs non-athlete for the following academic years:

AY 2020 - 2021
AY 2021 - 2022
AY 2022 - 2023
AY 2023 - 2024
AY 2024 - 2025
AY 2025 - 2026

Some of this information is posted, such as https://www.vmi.edu/news/headlines/2024-2025/cadets-lead-the-way-rank-announcements-celebrated.php, but it does not include race, gender, or NCAA status.

2. The targets or goals VMI set for diversity in leadership (rank opportunities) by race, gender, athlete, and non-athlete for the AYs listed above.

Maj. Gen. Wins and the VMI Inclusive Excellence program set goals for diversity and publicized successes in making the Corps more diverse in its makeup and, especially, in rank opportunities, while increasing leadership opportunities for cadets. It appears from the recent list that there was success in this area, but it is difficult to determine without the statistics, and for these successes, there should be goals to determine if they were met.

If these are available by links, I am willing to accept those.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Honor Court Documents 2 and MISSING RECORDS from FOIA 25-82

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Honor Court Documents 2 and MISSING RECORDS from FOIA 25-82
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. For AY 2024 - 2025 - The Honor Court Procedures Manual, Poster, and/or Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) (However it is termed)
2. For AY 2024 - 2025 - Honor Court  Voting Ballot for trials with any instructions or guidance given orally or in writing.
3. For AY 2024 - 2025 - Voting ballot for the Corps to elect Honor Court Members, with any instructions or guidance given orally or in writing.
4. For AY 2024 - 2025 - Any instructions or guidance given orally or in writing to Honor Court witnesses.
5. For AY 2024 - 2025 - Any training for Honor Court Members or Jurors
6. The Final Report of the Superintendent's ad hoc committee that reviewed the Honor Court Standard Operating Procedures (HC SOP) and reported out to the Superintendent in August 2021.
7. For AY 2021 - 2022, AY2022-2023, AY2023 - 2024, AY2024-2025, the reports developed by the The Honor Court, along with the Superintendent’s Representatives to the Honor Court and in coordination with the Chief Diversity Officer  that, in accordane with VMI's implementation of the B&T Report recommendations, "...includes demographic and DEI-related data" and are "...devoid of personal identifiable information, will facilitate an annual assessment of the effectiveness of these new measures in ensuring equity throughout the honor system.” - Whereas these were specifically designed not to include PII, they should be fully releaseable.

All of these are standard current records (1-6) or records that VMI stated they will routinely maintain (7), so they should be readily available.'

I AM ALSO REQUESTING THE MISSING DOCUMENTS FROM MY PREVIOUS FOIA  25 - 82, as The response you sent only included records up to AY 2020 - 2021.  THEY ARE MISSING AY 2022 - 2023, AY 2023 - 2024, AY 2024 - 2025. Also, this is missing some of the other information I requested, such as the number of cases referred for trial that the Superintendent dismissed either before trial or after conviction, with the same demographic breakdown. I said I would take incremental responses to my request as you gathered the files, but you never sent me any after the first tiny batch.

PLEASE SEND THEM

Under FOIA 25 - 82 I requested the following information:

1. Number of Honor Court Complaints or referrals (by source, such as cadet, faculty, staff, other, if possible) to the VMI Honor Court by academic year, race, ethnic background, and gender (further broken out by race and ethnic background), also identified as athlete or non-athlete.

2. Number of the Honor Court Complaints in #1 that were investigated by the same demographic breakdown.

3. Number of Honor Court Investigations in #2 that where Honor Court Charges were referred to the Superintendent for trial by the same demographic breakdown and indicated as approved for further action or disapproved by the Superintendent by the same demographic Breakdown.

4. Number of Cadets charged by the Honor Court whose charges were dismissed by the Superintendent based on pre-trial motions or for other reasons (with reasons if available) by the same demographic Breakdown.

5. Number of Cadets charged by the Honor Court who pleaded guilty to the charges by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

6. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court and found innocent by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

7. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court, Found Guilty and dismissed by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

8. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court, Found Guilty, whose cases the Superintendent subsequently dismissed and allowed them to stay at VMI by the same demographic Breakdown.

9. Number of Honor Court Cases where the Honor Court charged cadets but the Superintendent used his authority to adjudicate the case while the Corps was away from VMI (Summer Break, Furloughs, etc.) under the authority granted to him by the changes to the Honor System to make it more equitable by the exact demographic Breakdown.

10. Number of Honor Court Convictions appealed to the Board of Visitors Appeals Committee, and the result (appeal granted or denied) by the same demographic breakdown.

Data requested for the following Academic Years

2019 - 2020
2020 - 2021
2021 - 2022
2022 - 2023
2023 - 2024
2024 - 2025

Previously, similar statistics were made public through the media and the Barnes and Thornburg Investigation report before the requested years. The outgoing VMI Superintendent highlighted his accomplishments in ensuring racial equity, specifically for Black cadets. Still, the VMI Board of Visitors has not released his performance data in response to questions raised regarding their decision not to renew his contract. Other public documents contain statements regarding his successful efforts to provide personal oversight, review in these areas, and offenses, and prevent biased application of disciplinary actions (particularly against Black Cadets) to ensure equity. This updated data is relevant for the public to know the impact of his involvement in these areas identified as issues in the investigation.

This request is specifically NOT requesting any Personally Identifying Information (PII) on any of the individuals involved. VMI no longer announces the names of cadets dismissed for Honor Violations and those involved in Honor Court Cases are strictly prohibited from disclosing the the identities of these cadets, so there is no situation where this general information, which it is reasonably expected must be maintained to meet the committments to equity in the One Corps, One VMI Plan, responses to the Barnes and Thornburg Report, and VMI's repeated Committment to making changes to the honor ssystem so it is more equitable woudl violated any current or former cadet's privacy.

The response you sent only included records up to AY 2020 - 2021.  THEY ARE MISSING AY 2022 - 2023, AY 2023 - 2024, AY 2024 - 2025. - PLEASE SEND THEM.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Forest Service Grazing Billing Records Full Year

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Forest Service Grazing Billing Records Full Year
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Forest Service’s database of billing records for all permittees on Forest Service grazing lands across all regions in Grazing Fee Year 2024, which extended from March 1, 2024 through February 28, 2025. I am requesting that this database be sent in a machine-readable, tabular format such as Excel or CSV.
I also seek the user guide, user manual, or data dictionary that explains the column heads and other nomenclature in the requested database.

I am a reporter for High Country News and other outlets. Please provide a fee waiver, as all records obtained will be used to inform the public about the federal grazing program, a major federal program on federal lands. If my fee waiver is denied, I am willing to pay up to $25 for these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: Evergreen Solutions (Westhill High School)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions (Westhill High School)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

title: Washington Department of Licensing - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington Department of Licensing - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
January 12, 2025

via email to "DOL Public Records" <DOLPublicRecords@dol.wa.gov>

Washington Department of Licensing - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
 
To whom it may concern,

RCW 40.14.026(5)

“To improve best practices for dissemination of public records, each agency with actual staff and legal costs associated with fulfilling public records requests of at least one hundred thousand dollars during the prior fiscal year must… report to the joint legislative audit and review committee by July 1st of each subsequent year the following metrics, measured over the preceding year:

RCW 40.14.026(5)(l)

(l) The estimated costs incurred by the agency in fulfilling records requests, including costs for staff compensation and legal review, and a measure of the average cost per request;

RCW 40.14.026(5)(o)

(o) The costs incurred by the agency with managing and retaining records, including staff compensation and purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests;

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.

Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:

Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

Constructive Notice: Any and all communication(s) received on behalf of your agency in reference to this Public Records Request (RCW 42.45) from any unauthorized for-profit 3rd party company doing business outside the State of Washington will be the subject of a new public records request to your agency as to the origin and purpose of the communication as well as the identity of the sender of the communication.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

EMAIL RECORDS

Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Albuquerque/Bernalillo County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Bowling

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #PR# 31560

Good afternoon,

In response to the first part of your request, please find attached our current Brady List. As a courtesy we are sending this at no charge. Please be advised we do maintain a historical Brady List. If you do wish to obtain a copy of the historical Brady List a deposit would be required. The list would need to be reviewed for any cases that may have been sealed or expunged. Please advise if you would like us to send a deposit letter.
In regards to items 2, each file that is applicable to your request would need to be manually pulled and reviewed for any potential exemptions and/or redactions that may be necessary. This task will be very time consuming and would require a deposit. Please advise if you would like us to send you a deposit letter.


Thank you
Misty Williams-Bernabe

title: Overington Settlement (Department of Transportation)

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Overington Settlement (Department of Transportation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any settlement agreement in Kari Lynn Overington v. Levi Fisher, et al, C.A. No. 21-1133 GBW (1:21-cv-01133-GBW), which was filed against the Delaware Department of Transportation in the United States District Court for the District of Delaware.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

Responsive records are attached. Pursuant to 29 Del. C. §10002 (o)(1), these records have been redacted for personal information.

As all public, nonexempt records have been provided, this FOIA request is now closed.

Sincerely,

title: VR Police (San Bernardino County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: VR Police (San Bernardino County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department's procurement or purchase of VR training equipment:
- Brochures, marketing materials including videos and demonstrations, PowerPoints from VR companies
- Invoices, Contracts, and Proposals from VR companies
- Grant requests to purchase or trial VR software and hardware
- Emails related to meetings, presentations, demonstrations, or conference appointments with VR companies. 
Search 2020 to 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Wellness Champion & Wellness Teams at each Chicago Public School

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Wellness Champion & Wellness Teams at each Chicago Public School
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

- the name of individuals in the Wellness Champion role at each Chicago Public School during the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 school years
- the names of all individuals who are members of the Wellness Team at each Chicago Public School during the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 school years

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=17710

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N017710-061625
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
07/01/2025 Ivan Ivan 
Dear Ivan Ivan: RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N017710-061625 Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

- the name of individuals in the Wellness Champion role at each Chicago Public School during the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 school years 
- the names of all individuals who are members of the Wellness Team at each Chicago Public School during the 2023-2024 and 2024-2025 school years 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Ivan 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fwellness-champion-wellness-teams-at-each-chicago-public-school-188079%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ164Jy60iQjs6iHTUOyYGcc%3A1uRMU8%3AboyEv2efYu8T-KzWBB1C3egKI0vsgmh6bvm78q7H0NY RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that the dataset provided is raw data and may contain errors and/or omissions. Please be advised that the District does not comprehensively the track members of the Wellness Team at each CPS school. Thus, this portion of your request is asking the District to create a new record to answer your question. However, we are providing you with a dataset that lists the schools that have an active Wellness Team 
The Freedom of Information Act requires a public body to provide existing public records, subject to certain exceptions. The request must reasonably describe the requested records. A reasonable description requires the record to be reasonably identified as a record not as a general request for data, information and statistics to be gleaned generally from documents which have not been created and which the [public body] does not generally create. (See Krohn v. Department of Justice, 628 F.2d 195 (1980)). Second,  FOIA obligations apply to the provision of existing public records; a public body is not required to answer questions or generate new records in response to a FOIA request. Kenyon v. Garrels, 184 Ill. App. 3d 28, 32,    540 N.E.2d 11, 13 (1989) (quoting Krohn v. Department of Justice, 628 F.2d 195, 198 (D.C. Cir. 1980)). 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: License View Database

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: License View Database
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Until recently, it was possible to download bulk FCC license data directly from the following link: https://data.fcc.gov/download/license-view/fcc-license-view-data-csv-format.zip. However, this link no longer appears to be active, and I have been unable to locate an alternative source for the complete dataset. Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I am requesting a current copy of the License View database in CSV format.

Specifically, I request that the file includes the following columns:

license_id (float),
source_system (varchar),
callsign (varchar),
facility_id (float),
frn (varchar),
lic_name (varchar),

loc_lat_sec (float),
loc_lat_dir (varchar),
loc_long_deg (float),
loc_long_min (float),
loc_long_sec (float),
loc_long_dir (varchar),
hgt_structure (float),
asr_num (varchar),
antenna_id (float),
ant_seq_id (float),
ant_make (varchar),
ant_model (varchar),
ant_type_code (varchar),
ant_type_desc (varchar),
azimuth (float),
beamwidth (float),
polarization_code (varchar),
frequency_id (float),
freq_seq_id (varchar),
freq_class_station_code (varchar),
freq_class_station_desc (varchar),
power_erp (float),
power_output (float),
frequency_assigned (float),
frequency_upper_band (float),
unit_of_measure (varchar),
tolerance (float),
emission_id (float),
emission_seq_id (float),
emission_code (varchar),
ground_elevation (float)

If possible, I respectfully request that the dataset be provided electronically, either as a direct download link or via email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Herbert Allen Kordan (1926-2021)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Herbert Allen Kordan (1926-2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents on, about or mentioning Herbert Allen Kordan, including ELSUR and cross-reference documents. Please search in particular for field notes, agent's notes, memoranda, correspondence, and reports of investigations, and for documents relating to the FBI Responsibilities Program, FBI Dissemination of Information Policy, FBI Counterintelligence Program ("COINTELPRO"), and FBI blacklisting of school teachers, college professors, and other public employees between 1950 and 1969.

Name of individual: Herbert Allen Kordan
Date of birth: April 10 1926
Place of birth: St. Louis, MO
Occupation: Botanist; College Lecturer
Institutions: 
- University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), Los Angeles CA
- Gustavus Adolphus College, St Peter MN
Spouse: Julia Tisa Kordan (DOB January 23 1927)

Previous addresses, including but not limited to:
- 2728 Malabar St, Los Angeles, CA
- 11837 Darlington Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90049
- 8943 Hazeltine Ave, Los Angeles, CA 91402
- 417 N 7th St, St Peter, MN 56082

I am also providing the following documents to aid in identification:

- Certificate of Birth for Herbert Allen Kordan
- Certificate of Death for Herbert Allen Kordan

FBI reference: File number 100-HQ-440067 & 61-HQ-10149 Serial 4337.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dawn Kordan

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: Herbert Allen Kordan (1926-2021)
communications.communication:
This is an automated reply to inform you that the National Archives and Records Administration received your email.  

We have received your request and you will receive a response within 20 working days. Please note that submitting duplicate requests will increase wait times.  

If you have any questions, you can call our office at 301-837-3190. You can also visit our web page at www.archives.gov/research/foia.  


Thank you.

communications.subject: Re: [25-31725] Freedom of Information Act Request - Dawn Kordan
communications.communication:
Dear Dawn Kordan,

This is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act request, dated February
26, 2025 for records relating to Herbert Allen Kordan. Your request was
received in this office on March 4, 2025 and assigned the case number
25-31725.

Your request has been referred to our Special Access and FOIA office for a
search of our FBI holdings, including for files 100-HQ-440067 and
61-HQ-10149 Serial 4337. They will provide a separate response.

We also conducted a search of our Department of Justice holdings. We
searched the Department of Justice

Criminal Division Internal Security Index, 1930 - 1979
<https://catalog.archives.gov/id/729763> (Entry A1 1011) in Record Group
60: General Records of the Department of Justice. We did not locate any
records responsive to your request.

We do not consider this a denial of your FOIA request. However, if you are
not satisfied with our action on this request, your options for appeal and
dispute resolution are outlined in the attachment. If you have any
questions, you may reach us at archives2reference@nara.gov.

This completes the processing of your request.

Sincerely,

David Castillo
Archivist | Research Services (R)
National Archives at College Park, MD

files.title: FOIA Appeal and Dispute Resolution Options_25-31725

communications.subject: National Archives and Records Administration FOIA Initial Response Letter
communications.communication:
Dear Dawn Kordan,

I am writing in response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request
of February 27, 2025 for records in the custody of the National Archives
and Records Administration. Your request was received in this office on
March 3, 2025 and assigned FOIA tracking number RD 88508.

You requested access to FBI file numbers

Records Requested

Total Pages

Date Range

100-HQ-440067 on Herbert Allen Kordan

32

January 1963-August 1963

61-HQ-10149 Civil Rights Congress

3000

April 1940- December 1942



The estimated total page count for your request is 3,032 pages. Requests
that exceed 3,000 pages are assigned to our third-tier processing queue.
You will receive a response in partial fulfillment of your request after we
have completed the first increment. We will provide you with an update on
the status of your request and an estimated completion date at that time.
To give you an indication of our existing third-tier backlog, we are
currently processing requests received in August 2013.

Once we notify you that processing is complete, you may either visit our
College Park, MD facility to view the file at no cost, or order a digital
or paper reproduction. Our current fee for reproductions is 80 cents per
page, so we estimate the total cost will be $2,425.60.

If you are willing to narrow your request for a potentially faster
processing time, please contact us to discuss narrowing options.

You must notify this office of changes to your contact information. If
communication is returned as undeliverable and no return address is
provided, your case will be administratively closed. To change your contact
information or to track the status of your request, please email
specialaccess_foia@nara.gov or call 301-837-3190. Please include your FOIA
tracking number in all communications concerning this request.

If you are not satisfied with our action on this request and would like the
opportunity to discuss our response, you may contact our FOIA Public
Liaison for assistance:

Accessioned Executive Branch Records – Washington, DC Area

FOIA Requester Service Center: 301-837-3190

FOIA Public Liaison: Rebecca Calcagno

8601 Adelphi Road, Room 5500

College Park, MD 20740-6001

dc.foia.liaison@nara.gov

301-837-3190

If you have other questions regarding your request, please contact me
directly.
--

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request #RD 88508
communications.communication:
Good Morning Dawn Kordan,

I am writing to provide an update to the letter previously sent on March
19, 2025 to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of February 27,
2025 for records in the custody of the National Archives and Records
Administration. Your request was received in this office on March 3, 2025
and assigned FOIA tracking number RD 88508.

You requested access to FBI file numbers

Records Requested

Total Pages

Date Range

100-HQ-440067 on Herbert Allen Kordan

32

January 1963-August 1963



*The estimated total page count for your request is 32 pages. Would you
like me to complete a line-by-line review of the records you requested? *

Please be advised, we will consider any foreseeable harm standard when
reviewing records and applying FOIA exemptions for this request.


You requested access to case file number *61-HQ-10149 serial 4337*,
identified by the FBI as potentially responsive to your request for records
relating to Herbert Allen Kordan.

The file is on 61-HQ-10149 serial 4337 Civil Rights Congress, created
between April 1940 and December 1942. Based on my initial evaluation, this
file is deemed *unresponsive* to your request because Herbert Allen Kordan
is not the subject of the file. If we do not receive a response from you
within ninety (90) calendar days from the date of this letter to indicate
you believe the records are responsive, we will administratively close your
case.

If you are not satisfied with our action on this request, you have the
right to file an administrative appeal within ninety (90) calendar days
from the date of this letter. Appeals must be in writing and may be
delivered by regular U.S. mail or by email. By filing an appeal, you
preserve your rights under the Freedom of Information Act and present the
deciding agency with an opportunity to review your request and reconsider
its decision. If you submit your appeal by regular mail, it should be
addressed to the Deputy Archivist of the United States (ND), National
Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road, Room 4200, College
Park, Maryland 20740-6001. Both the letter and envelope should be clearly
marked “FOIA Appeal.” If you submit your appeal by email, please send it to
foia@nara.gov, addressed to the Deputy Archivist, with the words “FOIA
Appeal” in the subject line. Please be certain to explain why you believe
this response does not meet the requirements of the Freedom of Information
Act. All communications concerning this request should reference your FOIA
tracking number.

If you would like the opportunity to discuss our response and attempt to
resolve your dispute without initiating the appeals process, you may
contact our FOIA Public Liaison for assistance:

Accessioned Executive Branch Records – Washington, DC Area

FOIA Requester Service Center: 301-837-3190

FOIA Public Liaison: Rebecca Calcagno

8601 Adelphi Road, Room 5500

College Park, MD 20740-6001

dc.foia.liaison@nara.gov

301-837-3190

You may also contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS),
the Federal FOIA Ombudsman’s office, for assistance. OGIS offers mediation
services to help resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal
agencies. The contact information for OGIS is:

Office of Government Information Services

National Archives and Records Administration

8601 Adelphi Road–OGIS

College Park, MD 20740-6001

This concludes the processing of your request. If you have additional
questions, please contact me directly.
-- 

Francesca McCorkle

8601 Adelphi Road, Room 3500

College Park, MD 20740-6001

released to the greatest extent possible. Below is a summary of my review:

34

32

2

identities of confidential sources

(b)(7)(D)

You or your designated representative may view the file(s) at the National
Archives at College Park, Maryland. We require at least one week advance
notice to prepare for your visit and ask that you email
specialaccess_foia@nara.gov with your FOIA tracking number (RD 88508) and
the date you plan to visit. Please monitor our web page
https://www.archives.gov/college-park for details and updates, as the
operating status for the facility could change, affecting opening hours for
the research rooms.


If you cannot visit our College Park facility, you may order a digital or
paper reproduction copy of the file(s) at the cost of 80 cents per page. To
place a reproduction order, please forward this response to our office
email at specialaccess_foia@nara.gov or call 301-837-3190. A
mailing/billing address is required to generate a price quote, so please
include that information with your reproduction request.


It is possible the fees to hire a researcher may be less than the
reproduction fees. If you are unable to visit and you wish to hire a
researcher to duplicate the file, information on how to hire a researcher
can be found at this link: https://www.archives.gov/research/hire-help. The
National Archives does not endorse anyone who appears on the list.
